description: Several members of the New York State Council on the Arts were critical yesterday of Joan Davidson, the council's chairman, on hearing that she had questioned the fitness of Max Arons president of Local 802, American Federation or Musicians, to continue serving on the council in view of his involvement in the current Broadway muscians' strike.

title: Transcript of President's Speech Calling for Reduction in Taxes and Spending
description: I have asked for this opportunity to talk with you tonight because it is important that all of us begin facing up to a fundamental decision about our nation's future.

title: Madrid Holds Special Session Of Cabinet on Terrorist Action
description: MADRID, Oct. 6The Cabinet met in special session today under Premier Carlos Arias Navarro to discuss possible measures to deal with the resurgence of terrorist action that resulted in the death of three civil guards in the Basque country yesterday.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6 (UPI)Oil companies operating in the West may have a monopoly on gasoline refining, but the expected flow of oil from the Alaska pipeline should change that, a Federal Trade Commission report said today. The study also said two companiesthe Gulf Oil Corporation and the Exxon Corporationengaged in questionable activities in the Pacific Northwest, where they cut back operations but tried through restrictive leases to prevent independent operators from taking over their service station locations. It said that activity was halted after the F.T.C. began its investigation.

title: Common Market Aide Warns U.S. on Trade
description: LUXEMBOURG. Oct. 6 (Reuters)The Common Market's trade chief, Sir Christopher Soames, warned tonight that a wave of trade protectionism in the United States could affect United. States relations with the ninenation community.

title: Theater Unions Meet on Music Strike
description: A factfinding committee of the theatrical unions held an acrimonious fourhour meeting yesterday in a futile effort to bring an end to the 19day musicians' strike.

title: Byrne Sees Uphill Fight on Bonds
description: NEWARK, Oct. 6Governor Byrne said today that winning voter approval for a $923million package of capital construction bonds will be an uphill fight because of New York City's fiscal problems and the late start of the bondissue campaign.

title: Caster of Jets Hips New High
description: Rich Caster wished it might have happened when he was a rookie six seasons ago, but he accepted the fact yesterday: For the first time he stood alone as the most productive receiver in the National Football League.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
FASHION TALK
description: There have been women fur designers as there have been women brain surgeons, but none have exactly dominated their field. Which is one reason Viola Sylbert has developed a following for her furs for Alixandre at Henri Bendel. She understands what other women want from their furs, the intangible quality that goes beyond the obvious desire for warmth and status.

title: Gas for Jobs
description: The Congress has just four more days to actor else dip into its scheduled week of recessto avert an economically crippling shortage of natural gas for the coming winter. Already notices of probable layoffs and production cutbacks are going out to workers in several, states; two or three weeks hence this grim extra threat of unemployment could well become reality to thousands of industrial and farm workers in at least fourteen states.

title: AMEX PRICES UP IN LIGHT TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market advanced yesterday in light trading.

title: Senators Hear Opposition to Sinai Pact
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6A dispute arose today in Congress over whether approval of the Administration's request to station 200 American civilian technicians in Sinai would also bind Congress to support other United States assurances to Israel and Egypt.

title: Kissinger Will Travel To Peking Oct. 1923
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6 (Reuters)Secretary of State Kissinger will visit Peking on Oct. 19 to 23, the State Department said today.

title: Pirates Call Upon Rookie to Halt Reds; A's to Start Holtzman on 2 Days' Rest
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 6The National League playoff switched today to Pittsburgh, where the Pirates braced for their last chance to stop the running Reds from Cincinnati in their dash toward the pennant and the World Series.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, OCTOBER 7, 1975

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Terence Hallinan wits as Lead Counsel in Defense of Miss Hearst
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 6 Terence Hallinan, Patricia Hearst's lead defense counsel since her arrest on Sept. 18, resigned today, saying his services were no longer required.

title: FORD ASKS SLASH IN TAX, MATCHED BY SPENDING CUT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6President Ford proposed tonight to put $11billion in additional tax reductions into effect next year and to make permanent, with significant changes, the $17billion of antirecession tax cuts enacted last March.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: THIS SAINT LAURIE SUIT IN LOS ANGELES $250 EN NEW YORK $143

title: Advertising
description: Brown & Williamson, which long ago discovered that a premium offer in a cigarette ad increases the readership of that ad, is now trying a sweepstakes promotion with the same goal in mind.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES SHOW PRICE DROP
description: Excellent harvest weather over the weekend, a prediction of several more days of good weather and the outlook for bumper crops of both corn and soybeans tended to weaken prices of these two commodities yesterday in futures trading.

title: Inflation Is Said To Place a Damper On U.S. Recovery
description: A resurgence of inflation has placed a damper on the business recovery, E. F. Andrews, chairman of the business survey committee of the National Association of Purchasing Management, said yesterday.

title: Crowd in Street Waits, But All Seems Peaceful
description: The people at the corners were quiet. They watched and waited, chewed over rumors and passed along gossip. Actually, there was nothing to see.

title: Why They Vote Communist
description: ROMEAfter Germany, Italy may have the most modern road network in Europedespite the fact that Italy desperately lacks other public facilities, such as schools and hospitals. The reason, as a knowledgeable Italian journalist sees it, is the tight relationship between the Government and Fiat, the big auto maker.

title: CHARTER PETITION GAINS MORE TIME
description: TRENTON, Oct. 6The Appellate Division of the State Superior Court ruled unanimously today that Citizens for Charter Change in Essex County could have until Friday to get the 56,761 signatures needed to put the question of county government reform on the ballot next month.

title: PSYCHOLOGY USED TO END THE SIEGE
description: The police kept talking throughout the afternoon and evening yesterday, gaining the confidence of Ray Olsen and turning his hostility away from his hostages. Finally, after eight hours, the gunman grew tired, momentarily lay down his weapons and almost invited his own capture.

title: Experts Rule Out 2d Gun In Robert Kennedy Death
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 6More than seven years after the assassination of Senator Robert F. Kennedy, a panel of firearms experts has unanimously agreed that there is no evidence to suggest that a second gun, in addition to the convicted assassin's weapon, was fired in the killing on June 5, 1968.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: The Hunter
description: Having been smitten hip and thigh by the recent CBS television film The Guns of Autumn, American hunters are now facing a new assault.

title: Treasury Notes May Be at Under 8%
description: Wall Street analysts estimated yesterday that the Treasury's sale of $2.5billion in new 38month notes today would bring an average yield to investors of around 8 per centor slightly less.

title: Compensation Rule Key to N.H.L. Pact
description: The National Hockey League Players Association negotiated a fiveyear agreement with the N.H.L. owners yesterday that acknowledges the right of a team to be compensated when a player plays out his option year, becomes a free agent and then signs with another club.

title: BROOKLYN DIOCESE CLOSES 2 SCHOOLS
description: Two Roman Catholic high schools in the Diocese of Brooklyn were ordered closed yesterday because of the continuing strike of lay teachers. and 2,200 students were told to apply to other Catholic schools in the diocese or to public schools.

title: Cost of Environment
description: In spite of unemployment and the energy problem, sixty per cent of Americans today think it worth while to pay the costs of environmental protection, compared with only 21 per cent who are for keeping prices and taxes down at the risk of increasing pollution. This finding by the Opinion Research Corporation of Princeton is accompanied by the advice to its business and industrial clients that they learn to cope with and even capitalize on an environmental movement which shows little sign of abating, even during a period of economic stress.

title: Unveilings
description: SCHEINBettle. Unveiling in loving memory of Bettie Schein, Sunday, October 19 at 11 A.M., Mt. Zion Cemetery, Maspeth, N.Y. No postponement.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Philippine Jet Seized and Held At Manila; Libya Flight Asked
description: MANILA, Tuesday, Oct. 7 (AP)Hijackers seized a Philippine jetliner carrying 71, persons today, required the pilot to land at Manila airport and demanded that the plane be refueled and flown to Libya, which has given support to Philippine Moslem rebels.

title: Battered Women: II
description: For the wife who has been physically abused by her husband, shime, guilt, economic and emotional dependency, and belief that it's all part of marriage are only some of her problems. In addition, she is generally without adequate legal remedies.

title: Dollar Shows Drop In Trading Abroad; Pound Moves Up
description: BRUSSELS, Oct. 6 (UPI)The dollar fell on European money markets today, but the British pound recovered slightly from last week's record lows. The price of gold was mixed.

title: Ludlum Cuts Discounted
description: The steel industry insisted yesterday that price increases put into effect Oct. 1 would be maintained.

title: Increase of $20Billion In Debt Ceiling Backed
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6 (UPI)The House Ways and Means Committee approved today a $20billion increase in the national debt ceiling through next March 31. The new ceiling of $597billion would replace the current $577billion ceiling scheduled to expire Nov. 15.

title: Reds, A's Favored
description: RENO, Nev., Oct. 6 (UPI)Harrah's RenoTahoe racebooks listed Cincinnati as the 65 favorite to close out its playoff series against Pittsburgh tomorrow, but made Oakland a 75 favorite to prolong its series with Boston.

title: FORD ASKS SLASH IN TAX, MATCHED BY SPENDING CUT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6President Ford proposed tonight to put $11billion in additional tax reductions into effect next year and to make permanent, with significant changes, the $17billion of antirecession tax cuts enacted last March.

title: Federal Role in Crisis
description: For months President Ford and his top monetary officials have avoided offering suggestions on how the city might extricate itself from its fiscal crisis. The Washington catchword was consistency: If the Federal Governmeet was not willing to give financial aid, it should not intervene by dictating solutions to what was construed, after all, as a citystate problem.

title: Summer and Smoke Opens Roundabout's Season
description: The Roundabout Theater opened its 10th season last night at its Stage One on West 23d Street with a suitably misty amid atmospheric staging of Tennessee Williams's gently torrid parable of body and soul, Summer and Smoke. Following the performance, there wits a special presentation to the playwright from the City of New York, made by Mrs. Abraham D. Beame, representing the Mayor.

title: MAY BUNDY DEAD; TENNIS CHAMPION
description: May Sutton Bundy, the first American to win a tennis championship at Wimbledon, died of cancer during the weekend at her home in Santa Monica, Calif. She was 88 years old.

title: Hirohito Ends Visit Here With a Toast To City as Center of Culture and Art
description: The Emperor of Japan, a botanist in his own right, studied local flora at the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx yesterday and then toasted New York as a vibrant and cosmopolitan city that has certain things Tokyo lacks.

title: Street Scenes
description: In the effort to return the streets of the city to its citizens again, lawenforcement officers should take firmer action against individuals accosting men, women and childrenincluding many tourists unfamiliar with the bold language of drifters and beggarsat busy intersections and subway entrances.

title: College, School Results
3 GROUP EXECUTIVES ARE NAMED BY G.M.
description: The General Motors Corporation announced yesterday the appointment of three vice presidents as new group executives, the naming of three new vice presidents and new assignments for three other executives.

title: COURT TO REVIEW VOTING FUND LAW
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6The Supreme Court, on the opening day of its new Court year, agreed today to a full review of the new campaign financing legislation that restructures the way the nation's political campaigns are waged.

title: For Example, the Common in Common Market
description: There is a new world. Since the end of World War 11 the shifts in the global pattern have been almost beyond belief. One of the most startling has been the change in the status of the United States: we have moved from a position of undisputed leadership among nations to one in which we are being challenged in many places and over many policies.

title: Money
description: Prime 8.

title: A Tribute to Charles Weidman Draws 1,000 to Majestic Theater
description: Moe than 1,000 admirers and associates of Charles Weidman in the world of dance and Broadway, filled the Majestic Theater yesterday for a tribute to the moderndance pioneer who died here on July 15 at the age of 73.

title: Giants Are Returning Home To a Sellout Season at Shea
description: The Giants, en route to New Jersey, return to New York City next Sunday after two home seasons in Connecticut and play the Dallas Cowboy's at Shea Stadium. The New York club has sold out its allotment of season tickets, around 59,000, and all seven Shea games will be sellouts, meaning they will be televised locally.

title: EUROPEANS HALT TALKS WITH SPAIN
description: LUXEMBOURG, Oct. 6The foreign ministers t Western Europe's Common Market decided today to suspend trade negotiations with Spain. The ministers also agreed to offer Portugal a $187million lean to aid her faltering economy.

title: DR. BRUCE BOKLAN, HEMATOLOGIST, DIES
description: Dr. Bruce F. Boklan, a staff physician in hematology and medicine at Long Island JewishHillside Medical Center in New Hyde Park, died of a heart attack Sunday night at his home, 6 Northern Woods Drive, Manhasset, L. I. He was 38 years old.

title: So This Is Depravity
description: With the Democrats coming to New York for their convention next year, everyone is suddenly worried about sheltering them from the depravity of Times Square, 42d Street and Eighth Avenue.

title: 20 Missing in Oregon After Talking of a Higher Life
description: NEWPORT, Ore., Oct. 6The authorities here are investigating the disappearance of about 20 persons who apparently believed they could ascend to a superhuman level possibly in a spaceship.

title: KANSAS CITY PLANS TALKS ON STRIKE
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Oct. 6Both sides in the Kansas City firemen's strike have agreed to resume negotiations tomorrow, following the city's dismissal of 59 strikers who did not respond to telegrams ordering them to return to work.

title: LISBON PLANNING TO RECOVER ARMS
description: LISBON, Oct. 6In an effort to reduce the danger that fighting will erupt here, the Portuguese leadership has reportedly decided to disarm civilians who have obtained military weapons.

title: A Man Is Sentenced To Give City $3,000
description: A Federal judge put a defendant on probation here yesterday on the condition that he contribute $3,000 to the impoverished city.

title: I.R.S. CHIEF HEARD ON SCOFFLAWS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6The Commissioner of the Internal Revenue Service told a House committee today that the I.R.S. did not have to rely on illegal methods to get the names of Americans who open secret foreign bank accounts to avoid taxes.

title: Cafe de la Paix to Open After Major Renovation
description: FARIS, Oct. 6 (AP)The Caf de la Faix, one of the city's most famous landmarks, will reopen early next year after a major renovation, but with its 19thcentury character unchanged.

title: INDIA AND U.S. OPEN TALKS ON NEW TIES
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6 India and the United States held the first session of their joint commission on educational, economic and technical cooperation today at the State Department, and afterward, Foreign Minister Y. B. Chavan called on President Ford.

title: UTILITY OFFICIALS VOICE OPTIMISM
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 6Despite many hurdles yet to be cleared, executives of the nation's naturalgas utilities expressed optimism here today that the Senate will pass legislation this year leading toward the gradual regulation of naturalgas prices.

title: U.S High Court Sustains Ban on Restrictive Zoning
description: The United States Supreme, Court yesterday rejected an appeal against a ruling by the New Jersey Supreme Court that struck down local zoning laws that excluded families with low or moderate incomes.

title: Highs and Lows
description: NEW HIGHS25

title: Article 3  No Title
Banks and Insurers Sued Over Dual Directorships.
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6The Justice Department filed lawsuits today aimed at establishing the principle that a director of a major bank cannot also simultaneously be a director of a major insurance company without violating the antitrust laws.

title: Baseball Playoffs
description: AMERICAN LEAGUE

title: Between Fiscal Problems, Beame Greets an Emperor and 2 Contest Winners
description: The door from the east parlor to the dining room of Gracie Mansion was closed yesterday morning. Behind it, Kent and Shirley Madson of Fostoria, Ohio, were Chomping away on scrambled eggs, smoked whitefish, bagels and cherry preserves with Mayor Beame.

title: Cowboys Trounce Lions
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Oct. 6 (AP)Charles Young scored two touchdowns, including one on a juggling, fingertip catch of a 42yard pass from Roger Staubach, to lead the Dallas Cowboys to a 3610 victory over the Detroit Lions tonight.

title: Some Europeans Fearful Of Effects if City Defaults
description: PARIS, Oct. 6Many European economic specialists are warning that the value of the dollar abroad, the international level of interest rates and even world stock markets might be affected by a New York City default.

title: Gulf Dutch Unit Liquidation
description: ROTTERDAM, the Netherlands, Oct. 6 (Reuters)  Refleeting a worldwide surplus of oil tankers, the Dutch tanker subsidiary of the Gulf Oil Corporation, Nedgulf Tankers, announced today it was going out of business. Nedgulf Tankers said its four tankers would be sold and its crews, a total of 211 men, would he dismissed. Financial details of the sale were not immediately available.

title: Bank Rate Cut in Norway
description: OSLO, Norway, Oct. 6 (Reuters)The Norwegian Central Bank announced today it cut its bank rate to 5 per cent from 5 per cent, effective immediately. The rate was raised to 5 from 4 per cent on March 30, 1974.

title: Princess Julia Cantacuzene, 99, Grant's Granddaughter, Dead
description: Princess Julia Grant Cantacuzene, granddaughter of President Ulysses S. Grant, and long a leader in Washington society, died Sunday at her home in the Dresden Apartment House Washington. She was 99 years old.

title: Article 1  No Title
State Buys Vanderbilts' Adirondack Camp
description: New York State has just purchased Sagamore, the 1,500acre Adirondack Mountain Camp that was used by the Vanderbilts in the early ninteen hundreds, to add to the forever wild section of the Adirondack Forest Preserve.

title: Phone Issue Reflects BondIssue Rally
description: The keynote new corporate issue of the bond market this week, Michigan Bell Telephone's offering of $200million of debentures, is expected to have a yield of 9.60 per cent when it is offered publicly today. This would be nearly 20 basis points lower in yield, underwriters estimated, than comparable returns on toprated issues last week. There are 100 basis points in one percentage point.

title: Notes on People
description: The first ItalianAmerican elected to the United States Senate, John O. Pastore of Rhode Island, has decided that 42 years in public life will suffice. The 68yearold Democrat announced in Providence yesterday that he would retire from the Senate in January, 1977. He has been in the Senate since 1950.

title: A Faded, Aloof Vienna Keeps Old, Slow Pace
description: VIENNAVienna was the scene in September of one of the most important international meetings of the year that of the 13member Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries. About 100 journalists, diplomats and photographers stood outside the white, modern headquarters building, which says Texaco on it, while Arabs, Iranians and South Americans were deciding on a 10 per cent increase in oil prices.

title: Hills Assures Senators He'll Carpool With Wife
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6 (UPI) Roderick M. Hills promised today that, if confirmed as chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, he would share his wife's limousine while shunning any vocational conflict of interest with her.

title: 3 Bankers Urge Leadership by Financial Community
description: Three of the nation's leading bankers suggested yesterday that greater national leadership was needed from the business and financial communities to preserve the American freeenterprise system.

title: Woman Swimmer Circles Manhattan On Her 2d Attempt
description: Diana Nyad, a 25yearold marathon swimmer, successfully swam around Manhattan Island yesterday, on her second attempt in 11 days. Exhausted but triumphant, she was helped from the slimy waters of the East River off Gracie Mansion at 7:32 P.M., seven hours and 57 minutes after starting out from the same point.

title: Sun Oil Trims Gasoline Costs; Steel Men Backing Price Rises
description: The Sun Oil Company announced yesterday that it was cutting prices for leaded gasolines by 1 cent a gallon and for unleaded gasoline by 0.9 cent a gallon, effective yesterday. At the same time, Sun said it was increasing its prices for kerosene distillates grades No. 1 and No. 2 and diesel fuel oils by 1.5 cents a gallon.

title: School Boycott Spreads In Brooklyn's District 20
description: A community boycott of New Utrecht and Franklin D. Roosevelt High Schools spread to the elementary and junior high schools of Brooklyn's District 20 yesterday, keeping about threequarters of the district's children out of school.

title: FREEHOLDER DENIES TAKING $3,000 BRIBE
description: MORRISTOWN, Oct. 8Donald A. Farinella, a Passaic County Freeholder testified today that he had never accepted a $3,000 bribe to vote for the purchase of a commercial garage from Albert Scaletti, the former Mayer of Riverdale.

title: Capital Revels in 3Week Haydnfestl
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6When this city has a music, festival, everyone gets into the act; for Haydn lovers, the threeweek Haydnfest, now, about halfway along its course, could be a binge, a chance at nearly total immersion in they works of the 18thcentury composer.

title: Big Board Rally Continues As Trading Volume Slips
description: With investors still encouraged over prospects for an easing of monetary policy, the stock market extended Friday's gains in moderate trading yesterday.

title: Elizabeth Teachers Vote To Disregard Injunction
description: Elizabeth teachers, who went out on strike yesterday morning, voted last night to disregard an injunction ordering them to return to their classrooms. At the same time one other new school strike began in New Jersey.

title: About the Jets ...
description: The various injuries, from head to toe, proved negative after yesterday's Xrays. From the bottom up: Richard Neal and Gordie Browne, who hurt their ankles, are questionable for Sunday's game at Minnesota. Phil Wise has a groin pull and Carl Garrett has a sore jaw. Both are probable. ... The Patriots' rookie tight end, Russ Francis, impressed the New Yorkers with his three catches for 84 yards and a touchdown. He's one of the best, says Rich Caster. . . . The Pats' left cornerback, Bob Howard, on Joe Namath: He showed me why he was worth $400,000.

title: Feld, Dance Tyrant, Inspires Troupe
description: When Eliot Feld walked out of American Ballet Theater at the age of 26 to create his own company, he became known as the Infant terrible of ballet.

title: Treasury Bills Decline At the Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6Yields declined on Treasury bills auctioned today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: 4 Democratic Presidential Hopefuls Offer Economic Ideas at A.F.L.C.I.O. Session
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 6Delegates to the convention of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations heard four possible contenders for the Democratic Presidential nomination offer prescriptions today for stimulating the economy and overcoming unemployment. But the delegates, who responded with varying degrees of enthusiasm to the speakers, gave no formal indication of their preference.

title: National Study Finds Many Unable to Get Abortion in '74 Despite Supreme Court's Easing of Curbs
description: Despite an increase in the number of legal abortions performed following the Supreme Court decision of January 1973, that overturned restrictive abortion laws, last year between 30 and 50 per cent of women believed to need an abortion were unable to get one, according to the findings of a nationwide study released yesterday.

title: Newest Mansion Of the Whitneys: Opulent as Others
description: The tray on the flowerlined terrace table holds sterling silver mint julep cups; men's suits and women's dresses and evening gowns are arranged neatly in closets, their hangers covered with crochet work; Aubusson rugs are scattered over parquet floors; the dining room table is set with china and silver, and gold faucets decorate the oldfashioned bathroom fixtures.

title: CHARLES DE ANGELIS, BUILDER IN JERSEY
description: Charles E. De Angelis, president of Brown & Matthews Inc., an energy and construction concern based in Cranford, N. J., died yesterday in Overlook Hospital, Summit, N. J. He was 51 years old and lived in Mountainside, N. J.

title: WQXR SETS SERIES ON CARNEGIE HALL
description: WQXRAM and FM will broadcast a 12week radio series examining the history of Carnegie Hall, starting tomorrow night at 10:05. Entitled The Glorious Sound of Carnegie Hall, the series will include a retrospective look at some of the major events at the hall since its opening in 1891.

title: Old Friends Toast Groucho on His 85th Birthday
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., Oct. 6Groucho Marx started singing while the guests at his 85th birthday party last night were still out on the patio dipping into hors d'oeuvre and the latest Hollywood gossip.

title: Vilas and Orantes Advance in Madrid
description: MADRID, Oct. 6 (AP) Guillermo Vilas and Manuel Orantes, seeded first and second, respectively, scored victories in the opening round of the $75,000 Madrid open tennis tournament today.

title: In Memoriam
description: ARMSTRONGLeon, W. Jr. On Sept. 27, 1915. Beloved brother of Janet A. Scharf and Ruth A. Stewart. Memorial service Oct. 7, 1975 6 P.M. at First Church of Religious Science, 14 E. 48 St., N. Y. C.

title: Egypt Parades French and Soviet Arms
description: CAIRO, Oct. 6  Egypt celebrated the second anniversary of the start of the 1973 war pith Israel today with a military parade during which Mirage3 fighter planes bought from France earlier this year, were shown for the first time as they flew over the line of march.

title: Nieman Advisers Named
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Oct. 6 (AP)  Harvard University announced today the appointment of three journalists to threeyear terms on the Nieman Advisory Committee. The new members are Robert Manning, editorinchief of the Atlantic Monthly: Eileen Shanahan, reporter in the Washington bureau of The New York Times; and Richard C. Wald, president of NBC News. The committee advises the curator of the Nieman Foundation At Harvard.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article on President Ford's discussions with academicians that appeared in The New York Times yesterday, the surname of Michael Novak, a specialist on ethnicity, was misspelled.

title: Schools Weighing A Cut in Electives To Trim Class Size
description: City education authorities are considering reducing the number and range of courses that may be taken by high school students in a new move to cut class sizes in the upper grades. Such a move would mean that youngsters would take fewer elective courses and spend more time in study halls.

title: Kings Point Coach Is Displeased With Decision on Castaldo
description: George Paterno, football coach at the United States Merchant Marine Academy, insisted yesterday that Jerry Castaldo, the Seton Hall quarterback, is a professional despite a ruling to the contrary by the National Collegiate Athletic Association.

title: Sihanouk, at U.N., Praises Independence Groups
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 6  Prince Norodom Sihanouk of Cambodia told the General Assembly today that his country backed fully what he termed antiimperialist and anticolonial independence movements and paid tribute to American students and others who had opposed United States involvement in Indochina.

title: Talks Are Resumed By U.S. and Soviet For Sales of Grain
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 6 (Reuters)Soviet and American grain experts resumed talks today on a longterm sales deal following indications that the 1975 Soviet harvest would be worse than originally feared.

title: G.I. Education Cutoff Voted For Enlistees After Dec. 31
description: WASHINGTON, Oct 6 (UPI) The House voted today to deny G.I. education benefits to anyone who enlists in the armed services after Dec 31. 1975.

title: MGM Weighing Reno Sites For New Hotel and Casino
description: MetroGoldwnMayer, Inc., which derives threefourths of its revenues from its hotel and gaming operations in Las Vegas, Nev., is plannig to expand this business and is looking at Reno sites for development of a resort hotel and casino complex.

title: CBS and NBC Bar Live Ford Speech
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6Two of the nation's three major television networks refused to carry a live broadcast of President Ford's address on tax and spending cuts tonight, saying that if they did they would have to give equal time to other candidates for the Republican Presidential nomination.

title: CITICORP REPORTS 18% EARNINGS RISE
description: Citicorp, parent of the First National City Bank, reported yesterday an 18 per cent increase in operating earnings in both the third quarter of 1975 and the first nine months of the year.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Gala for Israeli Museum
description: A gala benefit in the Grand Ballroom of the WaldorfAstoria tonight will celebrate the Israeli Museum's 10th anniversary. Cocktails will be at 6:30, dinner at 8 and entertainment at 9:30. Mayor Teddy Kollek of Jerusalem and Baroness Alix de Rothschild of Paris will attend. A stage presentation written by Sylvia Fine will be performed by Danny Kaye, Kirk Douglas and Roberta Peters.

title: Gains Made in House Measure To Ease Municipal Bankruptcy
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 8The chairman of a House subcommittee said today that there was general agreement on the major provisions of proposed municipal bankruptcy legislation, which he said could be enacted before the end of the year.

title: Banks and Insurers Sued Over Dual Directorships
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6The Justice Department filed lawsuits today aimed at establishing the principle that a director of a major bank cannot also simultaneously be a director of a major insurance company without violating the antitrust laws.

title: GOLD
description: GOLD

title: Farm Labor Chaos
description: After decades of violence and intimidation intended to discourage free choice of unions by California farm workers, it is scarcely surprising that the first month of elections under that state's admirable new farm labor law has produced a rash of complaints of continued obstruction to the exercise of democratic rights.

title: A Score of Officials To Lose City Posts In Super Shakeup
description: In advance of the imminent restructuring of three of the city's nine superagencies, Mayor Beame said yesterday that 21 or 24 executives had been notified that they would be off the payroll by Oct. 17. Three of the executives have already resigned.

title: Highlights of Speech
description: Raise the personal exemption taxpayers can claim for themselves and their dependents from $750 to $1,000. Estimated savings to taxpayers would be $10.1billion.

title: How 2 Courts Differ on Criminal Law
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6  Of all the ways in which the Supreme Court headed by Chief Justice Warren E. Burger differs from that headed by the late analysts Warren, the one that legal analysts point to most often is the way the Burger Court decides cases of criminal law.

title: Africans and Arabs Denounce Moynihan in the U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 6African and Arab members denounced Daniel P. Moynihan in the General Assembly today for his use of the term racist murderer to describe President Idi Amin of Uganda.

title: ARONS CRITICISM SETS OFF DISPUTE
description: ARONS CRITICISM SETS OFF DISPUTE

title: Village' Bank Siege Ends After 8 Hours With Gunman Seized, Hostages Freed
description: A young man with a highpowered rifle and a pistol seized 10 hostages in a small Manhattan bank yesterday afternoon, but laid down his arms and wearily surrendered without a fight after an eighthour siege that ended with all hostages freed unharmed.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article on President Ford's discussions with academicians that appeared in The New York Times yesterday, the surname of Michael Novak, a specialist on ethnicity, was misspelled.

title: Merrill Plans I.O.U.'s
description: The parent company of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., the brokerage house, disclosed yesterday that it would shortly begin issuing its own commercial paper, that is, corporate I.O.U.'s. Page 50.

title: People in Sports
description: Martina Navratilova, the Czechoslovak tennis player who last month requested political asylum in the United States, has been granted permanent resident status by the United States Immigration and Naturalization Service.

title: Market Place
description: Stock of the McLouth Steel Corporation, which sells threequarters of its output to the auto industry, was the object of an unusual transaction in Wall Street yesterday.

title: COURT WILL HEAR WORKERS' CASES
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6The Supreme Court agreed today to consider a number of issues that may affect the lives of millions of working Amricanswomen, minorities, employes of the Federal Government and teachers.

title: Merrill Will Issue Commercial Paper
description: The parent company of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., the brokerage house, disclosed yesterday that it would shortly begin issuing its own commercial paper, that is corporate i.o.u.'s.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, OCTOBER 7, 1975

title: BYRNE CAMPAIGNS FOR BOND ISSUES
description: NEWARK, Oct. 6Governor Byrne said today that winning voter approval for a $923million package of capital construction bonds will be an uphill fight because of New York City's fiscal problems and the late start of the bondissue campaign.

title: Dividends
Hearst Lawyer Quits
description: Terence Hallinan, Patricia Hearst's lead defense counsel since her arrest on Sept. 18, resigned yesterday, saying his services were no longer required. Page 22.

title: Spanish Talks Halted
description: Common Market foreign ministers decided yesterday to suspend trade negotiations with Spain. They also agreed to offer Portugal a $187million loan to aid her faltering economy. Page 9.

title: Hundreds At Stengel Funeral
description: GLENDALE, Calif., Oct. 6Casey Stengel, an American institution who was born near the geographic center of the United States 85 years ago in Kansas City and won world fame in New York, in the East, was buried today in this Los Angeles suburb. It had been his home for the last 51 years.

title: State Backs Ocean Grove On Sunday Driving Ban
description: TRENTON, Oct. 6The State Attorney General went to the defense today of the small religious shore community of Ocean Grove in its fight to preserve peace and quiet on Sunday by prohibiting vehicular traffic even for the distribution of newspapers.

title: Experts Rule Out 2d Gun In Robert Kennedy Death
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 6More than seven years after the assassination of Senator Robert F. Kennedy, a panel of firearms experts has unanimously agreed that there is no evidence to suggest that a second gun, in addition to the convicted assassin's weapon, was fired in the killing on June 5, 1968.

title: U.S. Moves to Keep Alive 2 Charges Against Gurney
description: TAMPA, Fla., Oct. 6 (UPI)Attorneys for the Department of Justice filed a motion in Federal Court today seeking to keep alive two felony charges against former Republican Senlator. Edward J. Gurney.

title: Chilean Politician and Wife Shot Near Home in Rome
description: ROME, Oct. 6 (AP)Bernardo Leighton, a Chilean politician, and his wife were shot and wounded tonight near their home.

title: An Austrian Example
description: In the year that marks the twentieth anniversary of the State Treaty under which it regained full independence, Austria has again provided the world with a model free electionin a part of Europe where such exercises are rare. Chancellor Bruno Kreisky's Social Democratic party has retained its narrow majority in Parliament, apparently gaining an additional seat, after a spirited challenge from a revived People's (conservative) party, campaigning under vigorous new leadership.

title: People and Business:
description: President Ford will nominate former Republican Representative Benjamin B. Blackburn of Georgia to the Federal Home Loan Bank Board, the President's press secretary, Ron Nessen, announced yesterday.

title: Plan to End Mining In Death Valley Gets Administration Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6Administration officials gave strong support today to a bill, sponsored by Democrats, that would end the strip mining of thousands of acres of Death Valley National Monument in the California desert and other parts of the national park system.

title: Spanish Talks Halted
description: Common Market foreign ministers decided yesterday to suspend trade negotiations with Spain. They also agreed to offer Portugal a $187million loan to aid her faltering economy. Page 9.

title: Killanin: Games Will Open on Time
description: MONTREAL, Oct. 6 (Reuters)Lord Killanin, president of the International Olympic Committee, said tonight that he was full confident that the Summer Olympic Games would open here on schedule next July.

title: BEAMS PLANNING TO TRIM BUDGET $200MILLION IN '75
description: Mayor Beame will tell the Emergency Financial Control Board today that he plans tol cut $200million from the city's $12.3billion budget for this year and extend the wage freeze on city workers, as part of a threeyear financial plan to restore the city's solvency, according to City Hall sources.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: An offering of 500,000 warrants of Delta Airlines, Inc., to purchase a like number of common stock were priced yesterday at $3 each and are exercisable at $48 a share, Lehman Brothers, Inc., the sole underwriter, announced. The offering becomes effective today. The warrants expire May 1, 1978.

title: HAROLD C. TAYLOR
description: Harold C. Taylor, a retired vice president of the Chase Manhattan Bank, died Sunday in St. Barnabas Hospital, Livingston, N.J. He was 80 years old and lived in Maplewood, N. J.

title: Some Europeans Fearful Of Effects if City Defaults
description: PARIS, Oct. 6Many European economic specialists are warning that the value of the dollar abroad, the international level of interest rates and even world stock markets might be affected by a New York City default.

title: CBS and NBC Bar Live Ford Speech
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6Two of the nation's three major television networks refused to carry a live broadcast of President Ford's address on tax and spending cuts tonight, saying that if they did they would have to give equal time to other candidates for the Republican Presidential nomination.

title: Marriages
description: FELCHER  FRIEDMAN  Elinor J. Friedman of New York City was married to Martin W. Felcher, also of New York City. on Sunday, Oct. 5, 1975. Mrs. Felcher is the dangler or Lilian Friedman of Wood. more, L.I., and the late Jacob J. Friedman. Mr. Felcher is the son of Pearl E. Felcher of New York City end the late Frank Felcher. Mrs. Fetcher, a graduate of Mount Holyoke College is in advertising sales for Interior Design Magazine. Mr. Felcher Is a partner in the law firm of Freedman. Lilienthal & Felcher.

title: The Case for Tolls
description: Mayor Beame's stubborn resistance to efforts to clean up New York's dangerously polluted air has reached new heights with City Hall's move to contest a Federal Environmental Protection Agency order to impose tolls on Harlem and East River bridges.

title: Africans and Arabs Denounce Moynihan in the U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 6African and Arab members denounced Daniel P. Moynihan in the General Assembly today for his use of the term racist murderer to describe President Idi Amin of Uganda.

title: ROBERT CLURMAN, EDITOR ON TIMES
description: Robert O. Clurman, a writer land editor on The New York Times for more than 20 years, died Sunday afternoon in a jump from the terrace of his 22dfloor office at 80 Central Park West, near 69th Street. Mr. Clurman, who was 55 years, old, had committed himself to Mount Sinai Medical Center on, Sept. 29 for care and observation of a state of depression.

title: Red Smith
description: When Casey Stengel was still playing ball, his friend, Ring Lardrier, gave him a piece of advice. Just keep talking, the Writer said. When you're with a newspaper guy, don't try to feed him a story because you don't really know what makes a story that he can use Just keep talking, and he'll get his story. Casey did more than merely follow that advice. He worked at it. Naturally loquacious with a genius for digression, he polished and refined those talents until they approached the level of art. It is a pity be couldn't deliver the eulogy at his ?? yesterday, for only he had the gift of tongues to suit the occasion.

title: Centers Are Established To Aid Victims of Rains
description: Disaster  service centers were established yesterday in Queens and Westchester County to handle applications for loans and grants from victims of the recent rains.

title: Upgrading Sought In Sunday Racing
description: Tommy Trotter, who returned only a week ago to his post as the racing secretary for New York's thoroughbred tracks, has taken steps to improve the talent participating on Sundays in Belmont Park feature races. Only nonwinners of recent stakes have been eligible for those Sunday races since the sport returned to Belmont from Saratoga, explained Trotter yesterday. Those past events have attracted some highly competent horses. But why not try for some who are of even better quality?

title: Red Sox Name Wise in Bid for Sweep
description: The Oakland A's, says Reggie Jackson, are like salmon swimming upstream to reach their spawning ground: We might die trying to get there.

title: Moderate Recovery Forecast in 1976
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Oct. 6Despite the increasing uncertainty of economic forecasts, the nation's top business economists today offered up yet another one.

title: Books of The Times
description: As an animal, says Ernest Becker, man is fated to perpetuate himself; as a conscious animal, he is fated to identify evil as the threat to that perpetuation. Earliest man thought only of physical survival, and so he searched for food. Primitive man refined on this; he wanted not only to live, but also never to die. He progressed from physical hunger to a spiritual appetite for immortality, a search for guarantees of his personal continuity. Anything that threatened his lust for immortality, his cosmic heroism, as Mr. Becker calls it, had to be either conquered or appeased.

title: Partisan Politics Becoming a Major Element in the City's Fiscal Troubles
description: Partisan politics, which had been muted during the initial and still inconclusive efforts to avert a financial collapse of New York City, is now becoming a major factor in the crisis, with Democrats and Republicans each trying to avoid responsibility and blame the other for the crisis.

title: FOLEY VAUGHN SMARTT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6 (AP) Foley Vaughn Smartt, managing editor of the news division of the Voice of America, died yesterday, apparently of heart attack. He was 67 years old.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: RUSSIAN WALKS OUT OF PEKING BANQUET
description: PEKING, Oct. 6For the first time in three years diplomats representing the Soviet bloc have walked out at a banquet at Peking's Great Hall of the People.

title: China Given Little Chance of Success in a FullScale War With Soviet Union
description: China could tear an arm or a leg oft the Soviet Union in a brief nuclear exchange but lacks the technology and the supply facilities to fight a successful conventional war with her Communist rival, according to American and other military experts.

title: Police Decoy Wins City's Appreciation As Muggable Mary
description: Mary Glatzle, who is only 5 feet 2 inches tall and who weighs 110 pounds, has been mugged, threatened with rape and shot at. For all this she has earned the nickname of Muggable Mary and has been named one of the 10 most outstanding police officers in the country.

title: AMERICAN'S HANGING IN BAHAMAS PUT OFF
description: NASSAU, Bahamas, Oct. 6 (AP)A Milwaukee man, sentenced to be hanged tomorrow for killing a fellow American tourist, was granted an indefinite stay today after an appeal was filed by the United States Embassy.

title: Gunman Described as a Drifter With MovieBased Imagination
description: Ray Olsen, the 23yearold Long Island man who seized hostages at a Manhattan bank yesterday afternoon, was described by friends as a high school dropout with a vivid fantasy life that often led him to live out movies he had seen.

title: Schools Weighing A Cut in Electives To Trim Class Size
description: City education authorities are considering reducing the number and range of courses that may be taken by high school students in a new move to cut class sizes in the upper grades. Such a move would mean that youngsters would take fewer elective courses and spend more time in study halls.

title: Turks Feeling Pressure for Cyprus Pact
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Oct. 6Now that the United States Congress has partly lifted the Farms embargo against Turkey, the Government of Premier Suleyman Demirel is starting to feel mounting pressure from Washington and its European allies to make concessions on Cyprus.

title: State Buys Vanderbilts' Adirondack Camp
description: New York State has just purchased Sagamore, the 1,500acre Adirondack Mountain Camp that was used by the Vanderbilts in the early ninteen hundreds, to add to the forever wild section of the Adirondack Forest Preserve.

title: Rebels and Troops Clash in Argentina; 28 Reported Slain
description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 7 (AP) At least 28 persons were reported killed today in clashes between leftist guerrillas and Argentine security forces.

title: Absentee Ballots Cut Lead Of Austria's Ruling Party
description: VIENNA, Oct. 7 (UPI)The majority of the Social Democratic party in the Austrian Parliament has been reduced to three seats after the tabulation of absentee ballots, the Austrian election board announced today.

title: FINANCIAL BOARD REJECTS CITY PACT WITH SCHOOL UNION
description: The Emergency Financial Control Board yesterday rejected the agreement that ended last month's fiveday teachers' strike after Governor Carey told the board that the settlement's cost gravely violates the city's plans for fiscal recovery.

title: HAROLD GLASSER
description: SAN JUAN CAPISTRANO, Calif., Oct. 7 (AP)Harold Glasser, a retired assistant treasurer at The Associated Press, died Sunday. He was 62 years old.

title: President Praises Honesty of His Son In Marijuana View
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Oct. 7 (AP)President Ford said today that he has never tried marijuana himself, but he praised his 23yearold son, Jack, for being honest about his own experience with it. The President was asked his reaction to his son's disclo. sure in a Portland, Ore., interview in which the younger Mr. Ford was quoted, as saying, I've smoked marijuana before and I don't think that's so exceptional for people growing up in the nineteensixties. He added that he thought laws should treat marijuana as they do wine and beer.

title: AMEX PRICES TAKE A MIXED COURSE
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange closed mixed yesterday in quiet trading. In the overthe counter market, prices were lower in slightly increased trading.

title: Idea Is Preposterous to House Ways and Means Chairman
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7Representative Al Ullman, chairman of the Houte Ways and Means Committee, today characterized President Ford's proposed package of tax and expenditure reductions as totally preposterous.

title: Beible and His Tiger Mates Spell Trouble for Cornell
description: If Ron Beible of Princeton is as good a passer as Bill Campbell thinks he is, Cornell will be in for a rough afternoon when it plays the Tigers in Ithaca on Saturday. Campbell, Columbia's coach, got a firsthand look at the quarterback last Saturday when the Tigers romped over the Lions, 277, and was awed.

title: Saudi Oil Minister Says Net Price Rise Won't Be Full 10%
description: LONDON, Oct. 7 (Reuters)Saudi Arabia's Oil Minister, (Ahmed Zaki Yamani, said today that he did not believe the net effect of the recent decision in Vienna by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries on prices would be a full 10 per cent rise or consumers.

title: Ford Officials Reassessing Plan to Operate Primary Campaign Without Accepting Federal Matching Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7A tight fund  raising situation compounded by the threat of competition from Ronald Rea gan has forced President Ford's political finance advisers to re examine their plan for financing his 1976 primary campaign

title: Stock Prices Decline 3.15 On Dow in Light Trading
description: After three, days of advances, which added 35.50 points to the Dow Jones average of 30 industrials, stock prices backed down yesterday in moderate trading.

title: Golden Glovers Beaten By London Boxers, 65
description: LONDON, Oct. 7 (AP)London's amateurs defeated New York's Golden Gloves boxers, 65, in an intercity tournament at the Royal Lancaster Hotel tonight.

title: Play: Robber Bridegroom at Harkness
description: So at last we have a new musical actually on Broadway! No, the musicians' strike has not been settled. For some reason, best known to God and unions, the Harkness Theater is operating a special contract with the union until 1977, and it was to the Harkness Theaterbeing used for the first, time as a legitimate housesince its restoraLion a couple of years agothat the Acting Company Iast night opened its present New York season, which is to run through Nov, 8.

title: Red Smith
description: In the Red Sox clubhouse in Boston, a man said to Carl Yastrzemski, You run to second base the way you did in 1963. Yaz was pleased. He has heard his share compliments over the last 15 years, but not lately. Through the summer now ending, he heard more than his share boos. More than a few times he picked up a paper and read some wistful reference to the way he used to play ball. When there was mention of his 36th birthday, which he passed on Aug. 22, it was practically an accusation. So now, sitting on the bench in front of his locker, he looked up with a smile. In the offseason, he said, I run eight to 10 miles a day. Can't afford to let the legs go.

title: Mexico's Advice to Mr. Ford
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 7Once a year, the representatives of the nations gather here at the United Nations on the East River and tell us what's wrong with the world. And especially when they are our neighbors, defining their grievances and their hopes, we are bound to listen with the utmost attention.

title: This Time Better Luck or Skill
description: ATHENSThis country has received assurances that Washington will attempt a new diplomatic initiative to settle the Cyprus question following the end of a Congressional arms embargo on Turkey, which has just been voted, and after next Sunday's Turkish senatorial elections.

title: Saigon Cancels Rise In Consumer Prices And Voices Apology
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 7 (Agence FrancePresse)Apparently reacting to public discontent, the military rulers of the Saigon area have canceled the official increase in consumer prices that they introduced last month.

title: Henry Hudson Parkway Work Starts
description: Work started yesterday on the longdelayed rehabilitation of the Henry Hudson Parkway viaduct between 72d and 81st Streets bordering Riverside Park. Only two of the six lanes of the parkway in this area have been open traffic for more than a year. The rehabilitation involves replacement of steel supports and the entire concrete deck at a coat of $10.6million. Threequarters of the amount will be paid by the Federal Government and onequarter by the state. Raymond T. Schuler, State Transportation Commissioner, said: We expect to complete the job before the end of next year.

title: Penguins Win Opener In Hockey
description: LANDOVER, Md., Oct. 7 (AP)A thirdperiod slap shot by Colin Campbell, the second Pittsburgh goal scored by a defenseman, broke a 22 tie and gave the Penguins a 42 victory over the Washington Capitals tonight in the opener of the National Hockey League season.

title: FINANCIAL BOARD REJECTS CITY PACT WITH SCHOOL UNION
description: The Emergency Financial Control Board yesterday rejected the agreement that ended last month's fiveday teachers' strike after Governor Carey told the board that the settlement's cost gravely violates the city's plans for fiscal recovery.

title: Food Stamp Plan Seeks a Standard To Test Eligibility
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7Officials of the Department of Agriculture outlined today a proposal for food stamp reform that would standardize the way in which program eligibility is determined and would no longer allow welfare participants to receive automatic food stamp benefits.

title: Rangers to Open 50th Season
description: It's not true that Ed Giacomin played goal in the first game the Rangers ever played. But it is a fact that the 36yearold grayhaired man in the mask has been named to guard the Rangers' net again tonight as they open the National Hockey League season at Madison Square Garden against the Chicago Biack Hawks.

title: The President Show
description: What chance does the President of the United States have to get on primetime television to discuss Government tax and spending policies and such other nondramatic subjects if by doing so he will interfere with the inalienable right of Americans to watch Rhoda and The Invisible Man? The initial answer, on two out the three TV networks, is: None.

title: Strauss Says Primaries Will Produce the Nominee
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7The chairman of the Democratic National Committee predicted today that the party would choose a Presidential candidate who had competed in the primanes rather than turn to a noncombatant compromise choice.

title: Diverse Friends of Joan Payson Fill Church for Last Goodbys
description: Friends from the diverse worlds Joan Whitney Payson took part in filled the tiny family church yesterday in Manhasset, L. I., to say their last goodbys.

title: Hostage Tried to Subdue Bank Gunman
description: As eight terrified hostages and his girlfriend watched, a young Dutch actor hurled himself against a gunman who had taken over a Manhattan bank Monday, in a bold attempt to gain freedom for himself and the others.

title: AVERAGE AT 22.6% FOR COMPANY TAX
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7 (UPI) A compilation issued today, of the taxes paid by 142 large corporations last year showed they paid an average of 22.6 per centless than half of the corporate income tax rate of 48 per cent.

title: Lockheed, in Succession Move, Elects 3
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 7Directors of the troubled Lockheed Aircraft Corporation elevated today three executives, all with backgrounds in finance, to establish what they called a line of management succession prior to retirement of the company's chairman, Daniel J. Haughton, when he reaches 65 in September, 1976.

title: Hicks to Resign From Thompson
description: E. Wyatte Hicks, executive vice president of the J. Walter Thompson Company and former managing director of its New York office, will soon be leaving the agency, but not the business.

title: For White Rhodesian Farmer, It's a War of Nerves and Bullets
description: CENTENARY EAST, Rhodesia, Oct. 3Ann and Dick Faasen see themselves both as farmers and as warriors battling for survival against nationalist guerrillas who have shot at them and mined their roads in this region of deep bush, hills, ravines and rivers 140 miles northeast of Salisbury.

title: Grant, to Keep Goods Flowing, Will Pay 24 Hours After Receipt
description: The W. T. Grant Company yesterday notified New York's largest factoring and commercial financing companies that it would pay for new merchandise within 24 hours after receipt in an effort to loosen the restricted flow of goods to the financially distressed retail chain.

title: ...Not a Serious Program
description: Mr. Ford insults public intelligence by distorting the facts about the steadily increasing size of the, Federal budget. It is superficially true that the budget reached $100 billion for the first time in 1962 and doubled in the next eight years. But the President failed to mention the budget reform at the end of the Johnson Administration which led to the inclusion in the regular budget for the first time of Social Security and other trustfund outlays. This change in accounting practice explains much of the upward leap that Mr. Ford deplores.

title: Carter Panel Is Pressing for a Decision
description: A New Jersey Assemblyman investigating the triplemurder convictions of Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis said yesterday that he would not be rushed into an uncomplete report despite protests from a defense committee that he had promised to submit his findings to Governor Byrne this week.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 7A broad spectrum of the American labor movement appears ready to support ?? any Democratic Presidential nominee next year. The only exceptons with delegates to the semiannual A. F. LC. I.O. convention here suggest, are Gv. George C. Wallace of Alabama and Senator George McGovern of South Dakotaneither of whom is given any substantial chance to be the Democrats' 1976 choice.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Sportswear, it would seem, ?? over the world, and a pleasant prospect it is. Never have clothes been so relaxed, versatile and accommodating. A Tshirt pairs up with shorts for tennis, culottes for town and a pair of soft trousers at nightand the owner feels comfortable at all times.

title: Beame Ready to Give Order For Further Budget Cuts
description: Responding to the new state board now in charge the city's finances, Mayor Beame plans to meet with his commissioners today and issue austerity orders that reportedly will mean additional cuts of about 3 per cent in Police and Fire Department budgets acrd 8 per cent in those of other city agencies.

title: Beame Will Halt All City Construction Except Projects Well Under Way
description: Mayor Beame intends to sign an executive order today bringing to a standstill any new city construction projects except those well in progress and for which a legal obligation exists.

title: U.S. and China Plant Some Seeds of Friendship
description: GENEVA, N.Y.Would the American food shopper buy a spiny, Cshaped cucumber or a radish the size of a man's hand? How about a white eggplant, a headless lettuce, or a long, slender melon?

title: Books of The Times
description: Of the dozen or so books that have appeared in the last few months about the American Revolution, Thomas Fleming's is among the most graphically written (it is simple to guess that he is also a novelist), and it is also one of the best in relating its events to the concerns of our times. Although the book does not pretend to encompass the whole Revolution, it is inevitable that its account of the year 1776 should include a compressed chronicle of what took place before and after, so that a reader comes away with a fairly accurate outline of the conflict from Concord to Yorktown.

title: Merrill Offers for Sale Its Commercial Paper
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce. Fenner & Smith, Inc., the world's biggest brokerage house, will offer for sale today $50million of its own commercial paper  that is corporate i.o.u.'s  in a step to save money on shortterm borrowings. It announced only a day carlier that it was considering, the move.

title: Meyner Assails PATH Extension Plan
description: TRENTON, Oct. 7Former Gov. Robert B. Meyner, a lawyer representing Port Authority of New York and New Jersey bondholders, today criticized the agency's plan to extend its PATH rapid transit line from Newark to Elizabeth.

title: Eagles' Upset of Redskins Only Major Surprise So Far
description: The Washington Redskins' upset loss to the Philadelphia Eagles last Sunday was the most significant result so far of the National Football League season in which 39 of 182 games, just over 20 per cent, have been played. Otherwise the season has been predictable and there appear to be bona fide races in three of the six divisions, both Eastern ones in the two conferences and me Central in me American Conference. In the others the Vikings, the Rams and the Raiders have easy schedules and clear sailing to the playoffs.

title: The Dance: Feld Ballet Opens Splendidly
description: It was heartening to see the Eliot Feld Ballet pull its socks up last night for the opening of a sixweek season at the New York Shakespeare Festival's Newman Theater.

title: Another Evert, 7, Makes Her Debut
description: It was a big day for the Evert family. No, Chris wasn't playing. Neither was Jeanne. The main attraction was their little sister, Clare, 7 years old and making her tournament debut at Delray Beach, Fla.

title: Big Indonesia Attack in Timor Reported
Country Scandal by CSC Company
description: For many years A Country Scandal was Chekhov's lost play. Apparently written when he was in his early twenties, it was rejected for production because it was unwieldy. The author discarded it, but a copy, without the title page, was discovered after his death.

title: INDIANA STANDARD IN F. T. C. OIL PACT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7 (AP)The Standard Oil Company (Indiana) has agreed, in a consent decree, to make available Wyoming crude oil reserves to independent refiners over the next 20 years, the Federal Trade Commission announced today.

title: TV Phone to Link Lawyers In City to Judges in Capital
description: Two lawyers will present oral arguments next week in a small room in a telephone company building here to three judges sitting in Washington. The lawyers and judges will be linked by Picturephones, enabling the two parties to see as well as to hear each other. The experiment, on Oct. 16, will constitute the first time that such a device has been used in an actual court proceeding.

title: BOYCOTT IN 2D DAY IN SCHOOL DISTRICT
description: About twothirds of the 22,000 elementary and junior high school students in District 20 in Brooklyn stayed out of classes yesterday, the second day of a boycott held in sympathy with a boycott of two other high schools in the area.

title: 200,000 in Marijuana Seized
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Oct 7 (UPI)Two Washington state men were arrested and 932 pounds of marijuana, valued at $200,000, was seized today after an aerial chase from the Mexican border. Michael Bucove, 31 years old, of Renton, Wash., and Kevin Ward 24, of Seattle, were arrested and a bench warrent was issued for a third suspect.

title: '74 Lisbon Coup Took U.S. by Surprise
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7 Three Three senior American intelligence officials acknowledged today that their agencies had been surprised last year by the overthrow of the Portuguese Government.

title: Business Briefs
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 7 (AP)Abu Dhabi has cut the production ceiling for its two major producing groups from 1.5 million to 1.35 million barrels of crude oil a day, the Middle East Economic Survey reported today.

title: Checks: An Art Form
description: Design. It's on everything from bed sheets to airplanes and refrigerators, and it is gaining popularity on bank checks.

title: Big Crop Pushes Price Down
description: From roast pork with baked apples or apple sauce to apple fritters to apple brown betty and a host of other dishesas well as side dishes and dessertthe apple will be bobbing up on many tables in the year ahead because it promises to be a big apple year.

title: Ivy Victory Gratifies Lions' Coach
description: Columbia won an Ivy League game for the first time in four years; Clemson continues to be ranked first, Adelphi broke several N.C.A.A records; the University of California, Los Angeles, lost twice; West Virginia is no longer undefeated, and Hartwick, Howard, Brown and Cornell continues to win in collegiate soccer.

title: Labor and '76: Unions Believed Ready to Back Any Democratic Nominee Except Wallace or McGovern
description: Labor and '76: Unions Believed Ready to Back Any Democratic Nominee Except Wallace or McGovern

title: Advertising
description: A young man just out of business school, who once ran an inhouse agency, has written a paper that is very supportive of that kind of advertising setup

title: State Police Union Asks Court to Prevent Levitt From Using Pension Funds to Help City
description: A state public employes union moved in court yesterday to block the use of $250million in funds of state employe pensions to meet New York City's borrowing needs this month.

title: Miss Fromme Is Seeking to Dismiss Her Public Lawyer
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif. Oct. 7 I find it necessary to dismiss the public defender as co  counsel, Lynette Alice Frornme told Federal District Judge Thomas J. MacBride today.

title: Too Vague a Plan
description: The threeyear financial plan that Mayor Beame presented to the Emergency Financial Control Board yesterday was disappointingly vague in many respects. But it does make clear that the city must impose drastic new economies to balance its budget, restore its credibility in the financial markets and stave off the disaster of default.

title: Bankers' Meeting Gives the City a Financial Lift
description: Mr. and Mrs. Denzil Lowry of Ada, Okla.he is president of the Oklahoma State Bank (assets: $35million)spent $13 for breakfast at the New York Hilton Hotel on Sunday morning, and they were still chuckling and wondering over it yesterday, though Mr. Lowry said the meal included the first, and I hope the last, 90cent cup of coffee of my life.

title: Fezler Wins Opener in Ohio Golf
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Oct. 7 (AP)Forrest Fezler of the United States beat Bernard Gellecher of Scotland, 1 up, today in a match that went to the final hole in the opening rounds of the $117,500 International AllStar golf tournament.

title: About New York
description: Trotting alongside Frank Williams as he pushes his heavily laden rack truck through the garment center is almost like riding a raft through a wild river's rapids.

title: Arab's Bus Purchase Hurts Desegregation Desegregation in Louisville
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Oct. 7 (AP)A city school official says that courtordered desegregation in Jefferson County and Louisville schools is being hindered by Saudi Arabia's decision to help thousands of Moslems on their annual pilgrimage to Mecca.

title: OPERATING PROFIT OFF AT CHASE CORP.
description: The Chase Manhattan Corporation reported yesterday that its thirdquarter operating profits fell 53 per cent. The corporation, which is the holding company for the Chase Manhattan Bank, attributed the sharp decline to additional provisions for loan losses caused by the impact of adverse economic conditions on the huge bank's loan portfolio.

title: REINS PROPOSES 7BILLION FOR CITY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7Representative Henry S. Reuss, chairman of the House Commit tee on Banking, Currency and Rousing, today proposed legislation co provide $7billion in Federal loans and loan guarantees to New York State to ease New York City's fiscal crisis.

title: Hearings Start on Rises In City's License Fees
description: The City Council Finance Committee began hearings yesterday on a proposal to increase many license fees to offset operating losses for city agencies.

title: New SovietEast German Pact Omits German Unity as a Goal
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 7The Soviet Union and East Germany today signed a revised treaty of friendship that no longer mentions the reunification of Germany.

title: AGENCY MAY LOSE REFUGEE CHILDREN
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 7A Los Angeles Superior Court judge has ordered that 20 Cambodian children brought to the United States last April be removed from the control of a sectarian adoption agency.

title: Bridge
description: The temptation to double an artificial bid, thereby showing length and strength in the suit, is not resisted as often as it should be.

title: Distorted Perspective
description: Newsmedia coverage of the two recent attempts on President Ford's life has inspired charges that excessive publicity given to the wouldbe assassins may set off similar actions by other unbalanced publicityseekers.

title: POLL OF BANKERS PREDICTS DEFAULT
description: More than 60 per cent of the bankers polled at the annual meeting of the American Bankers Association here this week said they believed New York City's financial crisis had worsened to the extent that the city faced certain default on some of its outstanding securities.

title: INDIA'S CURB STIRS DEBATE ON LIQUOR
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 7A Government move toward prohibition has renewed India's perennial debate about the morality of drinking.

title: Beame Ready to Give Order For Further Budget Cuts
description: Responding to the new state board now in charge of the city's finances, Mayor Beame plans to meet with his commissioners today and issue austerity orders that reportedly will mean additional cuts of about 3 per cent in Police and Fire Department budgets and 8 per cent in those of other city agencies.

title: Policeman Is Shot on L.I. Trying to Foil a Holdup
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Oct. 7A Nassau County police officer was shot and critically wounded early this morning while attempting to thwart a ho?? at a boutique here.

title: Milestones, a Film on Radical Youth
Prices of Corn and Soybean Futures Rise
description: Strong weekly export figures, talk of farmers' holding back corn and soybeans and steady commercial buying helped to raise futures prices slightly yes. terday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Talks Resume in Strike At Catholic High Schools
description: Negotiations resumed last night in the fiveweekold strike by lay teachers against rive high schools in the Brooklyn Diocese.

title: Man, 25. Is Convicted In Fatal Beating of Couple
description: A 25yearold man who, when surprised in a Brooklyn apartment during a robbery, fatally beat an elderly couple, was convicted last night in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn of two counts of felony murder.

title: Jersey Legislator Resists a Call For Fast Report on Carter Case
description: A New Jersey Assemblyman investigating the triplemurder convictions of Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis said yesterday that he would not be rushed into an incomplete report despite protest from a defense committee that he had promised to submit his findings to Governor Byrne this week.

title: Domesticated Dogs Traced 14,000 Year
description: The fossil jaw and teeth of a domesticated dog, recovered from a cave in Iraq, have been found to be about 14,000 years old. This is the oldest known evidence for man's taming of a wild animalthe wolf in this case.

title: NEWS UNION STAYS ON JOB IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7Members of the Newspaper Guild at The Washington Post voted tonight, 270 to 251, to continue working during a walkout of printing pressmen that is now in its sixth day.

title: STATE PAYS 835% FOR $31MILLION
description: New York State placed more than $31million in shortterm notes with three Albany banks yesterday at an interest rate below that paid on some notes last month.

title: F105 Planes Grounded
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7 (Reuters) The Air Force said today that it had temporarily grounded 109 of its older model F405 fighter bombers until it completes the investigation of a crash near Augusta, Kan., in which the pilot was killed on Oct. 2.

title: Business Leaders Only Lukewarm to Program
description: President Ford's tax program combining tax cuts with a ceiling on spending received only lukewarm approval from business leaders yesterday. Many felt it was pure politics.

title: TEST LETS PUPILS QUIT SCHOOL EARLY
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 77Starting this year, all 16 and 17yearold publicschool students in California will be eligible to leave high school early and legally if they pass a special new test to prove they are literate.

title: Dominican Office Bombed
description: MIAMI, Oct. 7 (Reuters)A bomb explosion damaged the consulate of the Dominican Republic last night, but the consul, Aquilino Riacrdo, and his family escaped injury.

title: BRICKLIN IN APPEAL FOR ADDITIONAL AID
description: TORONTO, Oct. 7Malcolm Bricklin, contending he has found private American investors willing to put up $10million to help save his insolvent Bricklin sports car company, appealed today for another $10million to $15million in Canadian Government funds to reopen his closed factories in New Brunswick and resume production.

title: Prudent Diet Is Urged to Cut Cancer
description: BETHESDA, Md., Oct. 7Too much fat and cholesterol in the diet may be a contributing factor in producing some of the major forms of cancer that afflict Americans, a specialist told the National Cancer Advisory Board today.

title: Pierre Streit, 52, Film Director, TV Emmy Winner Writer Dies
description: Pierre defrance Streit, a film producer, director, cameraman and writer, was killed Sunday in an automobile accident north of Missoula, Mont. He was 52 years old and had lived in Washington and, until a few months ago in New York.

title: KING OLAV VISITS STATUE OF LIBERTY
description: King Olav V of Norway visited the Statue of Liberty yesterday, and touched a responsive chord in the children of immigrants who clustered to view him.

title: 3 Suspended Trot Drivers Balking Alain at Lie Tests
description: Two of harness racing's top three moneywinning drivers remained under suspension yesterday after they refused to take liedetector tests. Ben Webster and William (Buddy) Gilmour had been scheduled to undergo the polygraph examination at Roosevelt Raceway with two other sus pended drivers, Ken McNutt and Real Cormier.

title: Bankers' Meeting Gives the City a Financial Lift
description: Mr. and Mrs. Denzil Lowry of Ada, Okla.he is president of the Oklahoma State Bank (assets: $35million)spent $13 for breakfast at the New York Hilton Hotel on Sunday morning, and they were still chuckling and wondering over it yesterday, though Mr. Lowry said the meal included the first, and I hope the last, 90cent cup of coffee of my life.

title: Raleigh's Mayor Defeated
description: RALEIGH, N.C., Oct. 7 (UPI) Clarence E. Lightner, who ran what was considered a generally successful administration as Raleigh's first black mayor but was embarrassed by his family's problems with the law, was defeated for reelection today.

title: Idea Is Preposterous to House Ways and Means Chairman
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7Representative Al Ullman, chairman of the House Ways and Weans Committee, today characterized President Ford's proposed package of tax and expenditure reductions as totally preposterous.

title: Notes on People
description: Visiting a 750acre Illinois farm to see how the corn and soybeans imported by Japan are grown and mechanically harvested, Emperor Hirohito and Empress Nagako topped off a day spent mainly in Chicago with Mayor Richard J. Daley as their guide and luncheon host. The couple, arriving from New York, were niet at O'Hare International Airport by some 500 Japanese and JapaneseAmericans each waving both the Stars and Stripes and the Rising Sun flag of Japan. A 2yearold girl wore the only kimono, a pink one, and the welcomers included 250 Japanese children, pupils at Loyoyla University's Futabakai School, whose parents are in this country for study or business.

title: Higuera Captures Open by 2 Strokes
description: PORT JEFFERSON L. I., Oct. 7  Mike Higuera of Plandome shot a sixunderpar 66 over the 6,693yard Harbor Hills course today and captured the $10,000 Port Jefferson open with a 36hole score of 140.

title: Market Place
description: The money market fundchild of the 1970s' record high interest and a sliding stock markethas weathered a lusty stock market boomlet and appears poised for further growth and proliferation.

title: Goldman Is Accused Of Bribery and Plot To Bilk Foundation
description: Irving Goldman, the president of the Shubert Foundation, was charged in a new indictment yesterday with giving $4,350 in bribes to a witness to flee to Mexico City to avoid a subpoena.

title: UTILITY WINS RIGHT TO ADJUST PAYMENTS
description: The State Board of Public Utility Commissioners has granted the South Jersey Gas Company permission to change its bookkeeping procedures in a manner that could increase rates for its 122,000 customers by as much as 517 a month if the state is hard hit by an expected natural gas shortage.

title: HENRY CALVIN
