description: Bob and Michele (net Krantz) happily announce the birth of Dana Lauren's sister, Jodi Minoan, an Oct. 10, 1975.

title: Merrill Lynch Net Down By 19% in the 3d Quarter
description: Merrill Lynch & Co., Inc., parent of the brokerage house of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., reported yesterday that profits fell nearly 19 per cent during the third quarter of 1975 but soared more than threefold in the first nine months of the year to a record.

title: Phasing Out of Direct U.S. Arms Aid Is Expected Over Two Years
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14 Substantial majorities in two Congressional committees have agreed to phase out over two years the military aid program under which the United States has given away about $40billion in arms, ammunition and advice to its allies since 1949.

title: TravelWeary Tennis Players On Last Leg of Rich Grand Prix
description: Participating in the sixmonth Commercial Union. Grand Prix series of tournaments is an endurance test and both art ordeal and education in travel. There are about 40 tournaments in 18 countries and the man who wins the Grand Prix Masters championship at the end of the year should be acclaimed the world's No. 1 player, many tennis observers believe, rather than the one who wins at Wimbledon or Forest Hills.

title: FORD AIDES SEEK TO MODIFY LAWS ON SPYING HIND
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14The Ford Administration has become convinced that a significant part of the National Security Agency's foreign intelligence gathering, though vital, may be of questionable legality and it has devised a plan by which it hopes to continue such operations while protecting the rights of Americans, according to highly placed Administration sources.

title: Notes on People
description: To the relief of Japanese officials including 13,000 policemen involved in security, Emperor Hirohito and Empress Nagako were welcomed back to Tokyo yesterday with cheers from 2,500 subjects at Haneda Airport and 2,300 near the Imperial Palace. The couple's twoweek trip to the United States ended without incident.

title: Puerto Rico Seekswayout As Economic Woes Mount
description: SAN JUAN, P. R.The 25 years of industrial growth under Operation Bootstrap, which some observers considered to have transformed Puerto Rico from an area of neglect into a success symbol for the developing world, have come to a close.

title: Fixed Incomes Upset Family Stomach and Tranquility as Food Costs Climb
description: Joan Gannon of South Ozone Park, Queens, got a $40 raise in her weekly food budget this year. The reason Her husband, a plant manager, got a raise at his job.

title: ROBERT MACARTNEY, NEWSMAN IN CAPITAL
description: Robert Roy Macartney, a leading Australian journalist, died Monday in Georgetown liniyersity Hospital, Washington, after collapsing at his home Sunday. He was 58 years old and lived in Washington.

title: Lebanon's Peril
description: Arab League foreign ministers are about to convene in urgent session to attempt a reconciliation among Lebanon's fiercely feuding private armies. Nothing less than the survival of Lebanon as an independent state in the Middle East is at stake in these tragic weeks intercommunal fury.

title: Bailey Linked to Brideport Effort to Set Up Jai Alai Fronton
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 14The late John M. Bailey was named today as the alleged recipient of a $200.000 cash payment reportedly made by the developers of a Bridgeport jai alai fronton in return for help in obtaining a state gaming license.

title: Elizabeth Police TieUp
description: Elizabeth, N. J., police, in a safety campaign to dramatize a wage dispute with the City Council, tied up rushhour traffic yesterday morning. Page 41.

title: President Minimizes Split With Rockefeller
description: WASHINGTON, Oct, 14President Ford told a group of columnists and commentators today that there was only minimal difference between Vice President Rockefeller and himself on the subject of Federal intervention to ease New York City's fiscal crisis.

title: Miss Quinlan's Guardian Says Coma May Not Be Irreversible
description: MORRISTOWN, Oct. 14  The courtappointed guardian representing Karen Anne Quinlan, the young woman who has been in a coma for six months, urged Superior Court here today to reject her parents request to disconnect the respirator that sustains her. He also disputed contentions that her coma was irreversible.

title: S.E.C. Study of Rule 394 On Stock Trading Begun
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14The Securities and Exchange Commission began today two weeks of hearings an whether the controversial rule 394 of the New York Stock Exchange should be abrogated or modified to permit greater competition from off board or overthecounter market makers in transactions of stocks listed on the Big Board.

title: Times Square: Planning
description: The latest cleanup and planting campaign in Times Square is admirable but futile; it is, in fact, exactly what is wrong with the city's approach to the problems of the area. Like all other cleanings and greenings, it is doomed to failure in the absence of strong programs aimed at root causes.

title: EXXON'S OFFERING IS UP $50MILLION
TV: The Way of Cancer
description: For anyone arguing that television, contrary to conventional wisdom, is really incapable of influencing the mass public's behavior, impressive supportive evidence can be found in the history of the TV documentary. Focusing ominously on some crisis or other, the documentary is presented, usually makes its case effectively and then disappears into the news department archives. More often than not, however, the problem under intense examination remains remarkably unchanged.

title: CORRECTION
description: In a review of the film Let's Do It Again in Monday's New York Times, Ossie Davis was mentioned as playing the part of Bootney Farnsworth, a boxer. The role should have been credited to Jimmie Walker.

title: 4TH FUGITIVE SEIZED IN PRISON BREAKOUT
description: SALEM, III.. Oct. 14 (UPI)Henry M. Gargano, the reputed ringleader of a sophisticated breakout from the Federal penitentiary in Marion. Ill., was captured today as he trudged, sick and footsore, along railroad tracks in southwestern Indiana.

title: Advertising
description: After a little more than a year as president and chief executive of the J. Walter Thompson Company, Don Johnston has decided on some major structural changes aimed at making the agency grow faster domestically.

title: WINE TALK
description: It was almost a great year in France. As late as a couple of weeks ago they were recalling 1947 and a couple of other blockbuster years when they spoke of the 1975 vintage. It had been a great summer in the vineyards lots of sun, not too much rain, everything conducive to making superb wine.

title: DRIVERSWARN NEWS; TIMES GIVES NOTICE
description: The Newspaper Mailers and Deliverers Union told The Daily News yesterday that it would cancel its contract with the paper as of next Tuesday.

title: City Job Squeeze
description: The projection by the State Labor Department that New York City will suffer an overall job loss of 313,000 in the 1970's is valuable only as an indication of the dire state of the city's economy and the need for vastly increased attention to shoring up opportunities for private employment.

title: Scientists to Explore Colossal Trough Under Caribbean
description: Approval has been given for a bold venture in which scientists riding deepdiving submersibles will explore a colossal trough in the floor of the Caribbean three to four times deeper than the Grand Canyon.

title: About Education
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 14  A study of minority students in the San Francisco high schools strongly rebuffs the popular notion that blacks and MexicanAmericans do poorly in school because they have low aspirations and low selfconcepts that are buttressed by their teachers.

title: Amex Seat Brings $38,000
description: The Amex announced yesterday that a seat had been sold for $38,000, up $3,000 from the prior sale last Thursday. Seats are quoted at $32,000 bid and offered at $47,000.

title: Bridge:
description: A player contemplating a preemptive bed can comfort himself with the reflection that even if he is putting his head on a chopping block the opponents may not realize the fact and the chopper will not descend.

title: JOHN H. ROACH SR.
description: John H. Roach Sr., a retired senior vice president and trustee of the Franklin Savings Bank, died Monday at Fort Lauderdale, Fla., at the age of 65.

title: Portuguese Junta in Azores Weighs a DutyFree Port
description: LISBON, Oct. 14 (Reuters)The governing junta in the Azores, the archipelago 1,000 miles off the Portuguese mainland, is considering opening a dutyfree port.

title: 2 Countries Seek Custody Of 5 Seamen of Lost Ship
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., Oct. 14 (UPI)Indonesia and West Germany have applied for custody of five survivors of an apparent mutiny and mass murder at sea, but immigration officials said today they had made no decision on jurisdiction.

title: Richard Tucker Is Honored at St. Patrick's
description: Richard Tucker, the Metropolitan Opera tenor who died last January, was remembered for his talent and his great humanity yesterday at what was believed to be the first memorial mass for a Jew at St. Patrick's Cathedral.

title: Custodian of the Planet
description: The resignation of Maurice F. Strong as executive director of the United Nations Environment Program leaves that promising agency without the services of the man who more than any other brought it into being. His appointment to direct Canada's energy program speaks well for the determination of Prime Minister Trudeau's Government to reconcile the need for energy with the protection of the environment, but it can only be viewed as a severe loss to a global movement that has hardly begun to hit its stride.

title: Leonid V. Kantorovich
description: When Leonid Vitalyevich Xantorovich, on the eve of World War H, proposed a novel mathematical technique to improve central planning of the Soviet economy, Stalinist economists reportedly said that he had taken leave of his senses. He later commented, tongue in cheek, that this assessment, probably saved him from arrest or worse during the Stalin era, when any questioning of established ways of doing things by sane people was not easily countenanced.

title: A Return of 10% On LongLine Calls Backed for A.T.&T.
description: WASHINGTON. Oct. 14 (AP)  An increase from 8.74 per cent to 10 per cent in the rate of return on interstate phone calls for the American Telephone and Telegraph Company was recommended today by a Federal Communications Commission administrative law judge. It is expected to raise rates for long  distance telephone canoe, if allowed to go into effect.

title: CANADA ACTS MST ON ECONOMIC CURB
description: OTTAWA, Oct. 14The Canadian Government moved today to enforce a farreaching program of stiff restraints on incomes and prices announced last night by Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau.

title: Bailey Is Linked to Effort To Set Up Jai Alai Fronton
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 14The late John M. Bailey was named today as the alleged recipient of a $200,000 cash payment reportedly made by the developers of a Bridgeport jai alai fronton in return for help in obtaining a state gaming license.

title: For Woman Director, Hester St. is Victory
description: Hester Street. which is scheduled to open here next week, is a film about Jewish immigrants on the Lower East Side at the turn of the century who believe in the American dream but must fight to make it their own.

title: HEARINGS OPENED ON U.D.C. FAILURE
description: The financial collapse of the Urban Development Corporation last February followed years of a spectacular expansion of the states debt as well as years of questionable decisions in the financing and management of the housing agency itself, according to testimony, before a special state commission here yesterday.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title.

title: Morgan Didn't Try To Alter His Swing
description: CINCINNATI. Oct. 14In driving in the winning run for the Cincinnati Reds in their 65 victory in the World Series tonight, Joe Morgan was the same hitter I always am, meaning he didn't try to alter his swing with the bases loaded and one out.

title: A Summary of Actions Taken by the Supreme Court on Matters Ranging From Town Zoning to Obscenity
description: WASHINGTON. Oct. 14The Supreme Court took the following actions today.

title: Police in Elizabeth Cause A RushHour Traffic Jam
description: ELIZABETH, N.J. Oct. 14The Elizabeth police, in a safety campaign aimed at drama tizing their labor dispute with the City Council over wages, tied up rushhour traffic early today involent Association Local 4, said We're not on a job action. This is a safety campaign.

title: Cleveland State Goalie Shift Pays Off
description: Known for none of its athletic programs, Cleveland State went to the Clemson Invitation over the weekend and not only upset Howard, the defendine national champion, but also won the roundrobin tourney because Howard defeated Clemson, last week's No. 1 college soccer team in the nation.

title: Drug Arrest Without Warrant In Private Home Faces Review
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14A. the urging of the Solicitor General the Supreme Court agreed today to review a prodefendant ruling in a narcotics case that raises the issue of when, if ever, an arrest may be made without a warrant in a private home.

title: Justices to Weigh F.P.C. Role on Bias
description: WASHINGTON, bet. 14The Supreme Court agreed today to decide what efforts, if any, a Federal regulatory agency must take to prevent race and sex discrimination by the companies and industries it regulates.

title: 2 DEMOCRATS LOW ON FUNDS FORIZON
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14Former Senator Fred Harris and former Gov. Jimmy Carter have filed financial reports with the Federal Election Corn mission indicating that their Presidential campaigns are operating on very narrow margins.

title: Giants Herrmann Awaits 49er Call
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., Oct. 14Right now, Don Herrmann is in limbo, but after 4 P.M. tomorrow, the New York Giants wide receiver could be in San Francisco or elsewhere.

title: Mrs. Peron Returning To Buenos Aires Today
description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 14 (Reuters)  President Isabel Martinez de Pern will return to the Argentine capital tomorrow to resume her duties after a monthlong rest cure, the presidential press secretariat announced here tonight.

title: Under New Management
description: City Hall was working overtime last night to make up for a monumental miscalculation which could have cost New York Cityand potentially the statea last chance to avoid bankruptcy.

title: Banker Admits Paying G.O.P. Illegally
description: TRENTON, Oct. 14  The president of a hank that was accused of making an illegal $500 contribution to the Somerset County Republican party asserted today that the check had been contributed but was rescinded two days later when the hank determined that it was illegal.

title: Election Panel Nears Approval of Corporate Political Action Groups
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14The Federal Election Commission prepared today to give its approval to the establishment of corporate political action committees that make contributions to candidates favorable to business.

title: Procter & Gamble Ads Assailed For Their Deviction of Women
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 14 (AP) Durwood Kirby, Mr. Whipple and the Ivory Snow Baby, all Procter & Gamble advertising standardbearers, were assailed today at the company's annual stockholders meeting. A coalition of church and women's groups were defeated overwhelmingly in their effort to get the Cincinnatibased company to reexamine its advertising policies toward women, but not before a lengthy debate started by several religious orders with support from pickets from the local chapter of the National Organization for Women.

title: RCA Shows 8.6% Earnings Gain
description: For the first time in seven quarters, the RCA Corporation reported yesterday a gain in quarterly earnings.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Rick Barry of the Golden State Warriors returns to the scene.of former triumphs tonight when his team meets the Nets in an exhibition game at Nassau Coliseum. Barry, who led the Warribrs to the National Basketball Associatioh championships last May, played at the Coliseum in 1972 when he was with the Nets and found it a friendly place. In 23 games that year he averaged 32.6 points. Swell Nater, the Nets new center, whose knee has been slow in responding after offseason surgery, is expected to see action. Game time is 8:05. o'clock.

title: FORD UNINJURED AS HIS CAR IS HIT
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 14President Ford's bulletproof limousine was struck broadside by an automobile in downtown Hartford tonight after he spoke at a Republican fundraising dinner.

title: Australian Minister Resigns and a Crisis Erupts
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Oct 14 (Reuters)The Minister for Minerals and Energy, Rex Connor, one of the most powerful figures in the Australian Cabinet, resigned today, precipitating a political crisis that could bring down the administration of Prime Minister Gough Whitlam.

title: People and Business
description: In general, a Government proposal for reduced economic controls in an industry is enough to make an executive's day. Last week, however. President Ford asked Congress o reduce Government economic controls over domestic airlines and the reaction in airline circles was not joy but closer to dismay.

title: Beame and Goldin Argued Bitterly on Deficit Size
description: Differing interpretations of budgetary assumptions on which Mayor Beame based his assertion that the city's deficit was 3600million, rather than $8million, resulted in a bitter argument Monday night at Grade Mansion between the Mayor and Controller Harrison J. Goldin.

title: Batter Interference Covered by Rules
Two Unions Step Up Organizing Drives at Book Publishers Here
description: Two unions aie stepping up drives to organize 25,000 workers In the book publishing industry here and an official of one said that her organization was almost ready to seek bargaining elections at three ma ior houses.

title: Sanitation Chief Praises Times Sq. Cleanup Effort
description: On the fifth day of an intensive new effort to rid Times Square of litter, Acting Sanitation Commissioner Martin Lang inspected the area shortly after sunrise yesterday and later pronounced the Great White Way comparable to the ChampsElyses.

title: 12 Die in Hungarian Crash
description: BUDAPEST, Oct. 14 (AP)A crowded bus crashed into a train today at an unguarded crossing in eastern Hungary killing 12 persons, the official Hungarian press agency said.

title: Books of The Times
description: Writers, notably those of fiction, are so much products of their time and ethos that relatively few survive to be read and savored a hundred years after their death. The exceptions are those who managed to transcend the immediate concerns of their era and speak to the timeless complexities and perplexities of the human condition. Some novelists, in their lifetime, seem certainly destined to join the immortals, but never quite make it. One such is George Sand. Alexandre Dumas fits ranked her with his father and Baizac, while SainteBeuve, the magisterial critic, believed her the finest and most original of French prose writers. Proust was brought up on her works.

title: A Bankrupt City? Not in Europe
description: PARIS, Oct. 14 Municipal spending is more strictly controlled in Europe than in the United States, and if cities get into financial trouble national governments stand ready to bail them out.

title: INQUIRY INTO BIAS CURBED BY H.E.W.
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14The Dallas regional office of the Department of Health, Education and Welfare is telling women, Mexican  Americans and handicapped persons who file complaints of discrimination that their grievances cannot be processed because coiirtordered racial desegregation is consuming all of the department's enforcement resources.

title: Improved Lions Worry Yale
description: Alter Brown beat his Yale team last Saturday, Carmen Cozza said, That's definitely the best Brown team I've seen in 11 seasons at Yale. But the Yale coach is still not convinced the Ivy Ivy League race League is over. I doubt if anyone is going Roundup to go through this season unbeaten in the league, he said. The balance is excellent.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Dr. Rammamurti S. Mishra, founder of a Yoga study center in Harriman, N.Y., pleaded not guilty to a seconddegree murder indictment in the death of a 3yearold boy who he allegedly treated with acupuncture in place of prescription drug the child had been taking. Following his arraignment in Orange County Court in Goshen, Dr. Mishra was freed in $25,000 bail. A date for further proceedings was not immediately set.

title: WARNING IS ISSUED ON GAS DELIVERIES,
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14The Federal Power Commission warned natural gas producers and pipelines today that they hisked enforcement actions, administrative or in the courts. if they failed to deliver the natural gas volumes they had agreed to sell.

title: CORRECTION
description: In a review of the film Let's Do It Again in Monday's New York Times, Ossie Davis was mentioned as playing the part or Bootney Farnsworth, a boxer. The role should have been credited to Jimmie Walker.

title: Islanders Set Back Canadiens
description: UNIONDALE, L. L, Oct. 14  The Montreal Canadiens express, which had scored 25 goals in its first three games of the season, was stopped in its tracks tonight by the Islanders. The New Yorkers heat the Canadiens, 53, before 14, 112 fans in Nassau Coliseum.

title: Open Interest
description: (In bushels. 000 ??).

title: Food Costs Drop
description: For the third successive week seasonal factors and special sales offset advances in some food items and the cost of feeding a family of four in New York City declined slightly, the New York City Department of Consumer Affairs announced yesterday.

title: Three New York Banks Report Earnings Increase Rate Slows
description: Reports issued yesterday by three of New York City's major hank holding companies indicated a tapering off in the third quarter of the rate of increase in earnings over the comparable period of 1974.

title: A BICENTENNIAL MAP TRACES CITY HISTORY
description: New York City's place as a center of revolutionary activity 200 years agois the subject of a colorful pocket map published by the N.Y.C. Bicentennial Corporation for tourists and residents embarking upon the horouahs historic trails.

title: LISBON DISSIDENTS YIELD A BARRACKS
description: LISBON, Oct. 14 (Reuters)Rebellious leftist soldiers who have been defying Portugal's northern military commander tonight ended their weeklong occupation of an artillery barracks in the northern city of Oporto.

title: Si. Broker and 3 Indicted In Damaging Black's Home
description: Three lawenforcement officers and a stockbroker were indicted by a Federal grand jury yesterday for allegedly conspiring to vandalize a house in their white neighborhood on Staten Island to keep a black family from moving in.

title: Carbon Monoxide Traces Detected Around Jupiter
description: PASADENA, Calif., Oct. 14 (AP)  Carbon monoxide, the odorless gas emitted by automobile engines, has been reported in the atmosphere of Jupiter.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: PAZINSKI (Gdynia), Gdynia Oct. 28; sails from Port Newark, N.J.

title: BOMB IN PARIS HITS SPANISH BOOK HOUSE
description: PARIS, Oct. 14A bomb went off early this morning at a Spanishlanguage publishing house here, causing considerable damage but injuring no one.

title: REFUGEE JOB PLAN SNARLED ON COAST
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 14Ninetyseven Vietnamese refugees, crowded into a 21flat apartment house here, are marking time while public and private officials struggle to salvage a jobtraining program for them that turned sour.

title: FORD URGES SHIFT IN U.S. DRUG FIGHT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14President Ford released today white paper on drug abuse calling for concentration of Federal drug control efforts on substances that pose the greatest risk to users and lower priority enforcement against less destructive drugs, including marijuana.

title: Atlanta Teachers Strike Return to Work Ordered
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 14Thousands of teachers and other school employes went on strike here today as the labor unrest that has hit education systems in other parts of the country spread to the South.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: PICKUPS Interludes are back again today at Town Hall. Those intimate, hourlong sessions of music, talk or poetry on Wednesdays that have brightened the lateafternoon, homeward trek of many a midtown worker (along with a lobby cocktail) resume again at their regular hour, 5:45 o'clock, at 123 West 43d Street (between Avenue of the Americas and Seventh Avenue). Cecil Taylor, the jazz pianist, starts the fifth season of Interludes, flanked by Jimmy Lyon's alto sax and Andrew Cyrille's drums; a new Taylor composition, Columns, will have its premiere. Admission, as before, is $2.50. There's a series subscription price. Information: JU 24536.

title: 600 at Rites for Youth Who Aided Friend
description: Fifteenyearold James Walsh was given a hero's funeral yesterday, a funeral that reflected the grief and fear in the Kingsbridge section of the Bronx, where he lived and died.

title: The Series: What They Talk About
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 19When Rick pitched for the Phillies, he won a nohit, norun game here against the Cincinnati Reds. Pitching for the Cardinals, he had another no hitter in Riverfront Stadium until Joe Morgan singled in the ninth inning. Starting for the Boston Red Sox tonight in the third match for the baseball championship of creation, he allowed four hits in 4 innings. Three were home runs and the other a triple but even so, the Reds had to go to the 10th inning for a 65 victory and a lead of two games to one. Maybe Rick should have been given a refresher course on handling the resident housewreckers, but Boston's leaders felt he knew as much as they did. That requires great strength of character on the part of the manager and his coaches, said Lefty Gomez, who studied human nature with the Yankees of Joe McCarthy's time up. They love to hold clubhouse meetings and go over the hitters, as they call it. I remember the first allStar game 1933 when Connie Mack was the American League manager. He had Jimmy Dykes, who was managing the While Sox, and Rogers Hornsby of the St. Louis Browns coaches. I was the starting pitcher. In the clubhouse they started through the roster of the National League squadPepper Martin, fastball hitter; Frank Frisch, fastball hitter Chuck Klein, fastball hitter; Chick Haley, fastball hitter.

title: School Boards Unite to Fight Further Budget Cuts
description: Representatives of many of the city's community schoo boards said last night that they would refuse to accept any further budget cuts even if meant a confrontation with the city administration.sent trustees to take over local districts because of the refusal to cut the budget further, they will have the parents to contend with. I am sure the parents will not permit this to happen.

title: I.B.M. Is Seeking Writ of Mandamus In Antitrust Cast
description: The International Business Machines Corporation, in a highly unusual move, filed a petition yesterday asking the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit to grant a writ of mandamus that would force Judge David N. Edelstein, the judge in the Justice Department's antitrust action against I.B.M., to change certain of his court procedures.

title: Transplanted Yankee Surmounts Culinary Challenges of South
description: NAG'S HEAD, N. C.It has long been our persuasion that Southern cooking in the home, whether it be soul food or conventional bourgeois dishes such as beaten biscuits with baked country ham, is the best and most varied in America. We grew up in the land of corn pones and hominy grits, and we can hear the hoots and jeers of our colleagues when we say that we have an unabashed passion for the likes of hush puppies and spoon bread.

title: TWO ECONOMISTS WIN NOBEL PRIZES
description: STOCKHOLM, Oct. 14 Leonid V. Kantorovich of the Soviet Union and Tjalling C. Koopmans of Yale University were named by the Swedish Royal Academy of Science today as cowinners of the 1975 Nobel Memorial Prize in Fcnnomic Science.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor As a former New Yorker with fond memories of my native city who has lived in the Washington, D.C., area for most of the last 35 years, I should Eke to suggest a partial, solution for New York's fiscal crisis which has worked in Washington.

title: 3 ALLIES REAFFIRM RIGHTS IN GERMANY
description: BONN, Oct. 14 (Reuters)Britain, France and the United States said today that their rights and responsibilities for Berlin and Germany as a whole were unaffected by the friend. ship treaty signed in Moscow last week by the Soviet Union and East Germany.

title: BLAZE IS CONTAINED IN COLORADO FOREST
description: EAGLE, Colo. Oct. 14 (UPI)Firemen formed a perimeter around a huge fire in the White River National Forest today, successfully containing the blaze that had burned out of control for three days and threatened one of the nation's largest stands of ponderosa pines.

title: SCHIFFMAN PLEADS GUILTY TO FRAUD
description: Stuart Schiffman, former president of a New York brokerage firm, pleaded guilty here yesterday to charges of taking part in a stock inflation conspiracy which involved kickbacks to brokers, United Press International reports.

title: BECAME TO DETAIL ADDITIONAL CUTS; NEW LAYOFFS SEEN
description: Governor Carey and other members of the Emergency Financial Control Board summoned Mayor Beame to a private meeting yesterday and, after reportedly indicating displeasure with the pace of his budget:cutting plans, heard him agreglo present greater details today in meeting a state mandate to impose $200million in fresh budget cuts.

title: U.S. Wins 3 Track Gold Medals in Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY, Oct. 14 (UPI)  The United States track and field team struck back at the seventh PanAmerican Games today by winning three of six finals, but the drama came when Cuba's Silvio Leonard fell headlong into the stadium moat after winning the 100meter dash.

title: Philip Morris Posts Record Earnings
description: Philip Morris, Inc., reported yesterday record revenues and earnings for the quarter and nine months ended Sept. 30.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES.

title: John Denver Awarded 2 Country Music Titles
description: NASHVILLE, Oct. 14 (AP)  John Denver was named country music entertainer of the year in the ninth annual Country Music Association Awards last night. He also won the song of the year award for his Back Home Again.

title: 3,000 Bridze Tokens Stolen
description: JAMESTOWN, R.I., Oct. 14 (UPI)  Three gunmen escaped with 3,000 bridge tokens valued at $1 each and $100 in cash at the Newport Bridge Administration Building today.

title: For Those Who Know Where, It's Sweet Cider Time Briefly
description: This is National. Apple Month, orchard men are bringing; in record crops, apples and apple cider are among the few foods available at lower prices than last yearbut good apple bider, sweet cider that is unpasteurized and contains no preservatives is still hard to find.

title: All 10 Clubs To Continue In W.F.L.
description: The World Football League, in a statement released here yesterday, announced that it would continue to operate with 10 teams.

title: Boozer Not Bitter Over Backup Role
description: HEMPSTEAD, LI., Oct 14 Emerson Boozer has been preparing for today since 1966, his rookie year.

title: OTIS ELEVATOR CO. GETS TENDER BID
description: In one of the largest acquisition offers of the year, the United Technologies Corporation yesterday made a tender bid of $189million for 55 per cent of the capital shares of the Otis Elevator Company.

title: LUCRETIA SAXL
description: Lucretia Hildreth Saxl, an executive officer of Tensitron, Inc., a manufacturing concern in Harvard, Mass., died Oct. 6 of a heart attack while en route with her husband, Dr. Erwin J. Saxl, to their winter home in Indialantic, Fla. She was 61 years old and lived also in Harvard.

title: Kibbee Proposes 20% Cut In Scope of City University
description: Robert J. Kibbee, the chancellor of the City University, has sent to the Board of Higher Education a farranging set of proposals for restructuring the university to cut its scale of operations by 20 per cent.

title: North Korea Accuses U.S.
description: TOKYO, Oct. 14 (AP)North Korea, in a broadcast by the Korean Central News Agency. accused the United States today of planning to send 60 new jet fighters worth $205million to South Korea to instigate. bellicose elements thth.e to provoke a new Korean war. There was no immediate. comment from United States officials.

title: Business Records
description: Business Records.

title: The Stage: An Arresting Section D
description: Section D in the Wiwacary rehabilitation home for boys is a closed society. A tough youth oddly nicknamed Kitty is the leader of the pack and any stray step, even a nod of welcome to a newcomer, is an infraction of his law and subject to punishment. The fact is that Kitty is far more of a disciplinarian than the officer in charge of the sectionwho is demanding but humane.

title: Court Asked to Block Plea For More Rosenberg Files
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14 (UPI) The Justice Department asked a Federal district court today to block further demands by the sons of Julius and Ethel Rosenberg for records of an investigation that led to their execution as Soviet spies.

title: Rear Adm. James D. Craik Dies ExCoast Guard Leader Was 64
description: Rear Adm. James D. Craik, a retired Coast Guard officer and former superintendent of the Texas Maritime Academy, died last Wednesday at the United States Public Health Service Hospital, Galveston, Tex. He was 64 and a resident of Galveston.

title: SPANISH GENERALS AFFIRM LOYALTY
description: MADRID, Oct. 14Several Spanish military commanders made public statements today asserting that the armed forces remained united in their loyalty to the Government of Generalissimo Francisco Franco despite a few defections.

title: Bid to Aid Thai Farmers Failing
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Oct. 14 Thailand is failing in her efforts to break the cycle of poverty of her farmers, a failure that, according to members of the Government, civil servants, Western economists and diplomats, could mean the difference in the long run for the success or failure of democracy here.

title: Bed Sheets Inspire a Bright New World of Design
description: Whether the sleep is sounder, and the dreams are Sweeter, is beside the point. Any bed without designer sheets these days is like Cinderella before the fairy godmother hove into view.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Tuesday.

title: News Summary and Index.
description: Tjalling C. Koopmans of Yale and Leonid V. Kantorovich of the Soviet Union will share the Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Science. The announcement by the Swedish Royal Academy of Science said they were cited for their contribution to the theory of optimum allocation of resources, leading to improved economic planning. The two men conducted broadly similar work, largely independent of each other but with some contact in the last 20 years. [Page 1, Columns 23.].

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title.

title: Reds Win in 10 Innings, 65, Take 21 Lead in Series
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 14The Cincinnati Reds and Boston Red Sox resumed the World Series tonight, with Gary Nolan and Rick Wise trying to pitch their teams into the lead before 55,000 persons in Riverfront Stadium and a national television audience.

title: Korea's Young First Lady Makes Her Own Way
description: SEOULThe elder daughter of President Park Chung Hee of South. Korea, Park Keun Hae, has emerged in recent months as the First Lady of her nation.

title: Proposal Would Govern U.S. Clinical Laboratories
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14 (UPI) Legislation to provide greater government regulation of the clinical laboratories that conduct blood and other health tests will be introduced after the Congressional recess, Representative Paul G. Rogers, Democrat of Florida says.

title: Market Place
description: There is considerable debate among bank analysts over the degree to which the banks face losses as a result of heavy investments in the troubled real estate investment trust field.

title: 50 Child Labor Violations Charged to Food Packers
description: TRENTON, Oct. 14  The State Department of Labor and Industry has charged two agricultural processors with 50 violations of the state's child labor law.

title: Antiperspirant Kills Youth
description: HOLLY RIDGE, N. C., Oct. 14 (AP)An autopsy has disclosed that Wayne Pope, 15 years old, died from sniffing an antiperspirant, the authorities reported today. He was found Saturday night on the bathroom floor of his home here.

title: Rodino Terms Testimony Of Rozelle, Garvey Useful
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14Pete Rozelle, commissioner of the National Football League, and Ed Garvey, executive secretary of the players union, gave conflicting testimony today before a House Judiciary subcommittee hearing on legislation aimed at eliminating professional sports reserve system.

title: Unions Assail Beame's Financial Plan
description: Leaders of the city's municipal labor unions assailed Mayor Beame's financial plan yesterday and warned that continued wholesale firings and the end of collective bargaining could eventually lead to a general strike.

title: NNYCFM to Broadcast Repeats of Goon Show
description: WNYCFM radio will broadcast repeats of The Goon Show, a British Broadcasting Corporation comedy series from the nineteenfifties. The halfhour programs are scheduled to begin on Thursday, Nov. 6, at 10:30 P.M. and are being presented in cooperation with National Public Radio.

title: Robert D. Dinsmore Dies ExTimes Copy Editor, 77
description: Robert D. Dinsmore, a retired copy editor for The New York Times, died Monday at his home in Forest Hills, Queens. He was 177 years old and lived at 116.33 Union Turnpike.

title: Philadelphia Fire Is Out
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 14 (AP) The ninealarm fire that roared through a gasolinel blending area at the Atlantic Richfield Company refinery flickered out this morning, nearly 36 hours after it began. Mayor Frank L. Rizzo who had a hone shattered in his right thigh as he fled a gas line explosion was reported resting, comfortably after surgery yesterday.

title: As I Was Telling Jerry
description: WASHINGTONOne of the most dramatic turnabouts on the international scene in recent years has been the alignment of the foreign policies of the United States, and China. There are few places on earth, indeed, where Gerald Ford and Mao Tsetung are truly at odds.

title: Torture in Chile Is Charged by a U.N. Inquiry Team
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 14A United Nations report on Chile, issued today, charges that torture centers are being operated in Santiago and other parts of the country.

title: PROTESTANT GROUP BARS ULSTER DOVE
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Oct. 14A Protestant political leader who favors the sharing of power with the Roman Catholic minority was suspended today from the grouping of Protestant parties known as the United Ulster Unionist Coalition.

title: Blues Tally Early, Beat Scouts, 51
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 14 (AP)Gary Unger got two goals in the opening five minutes, sparking the St. Louis Blues to a 51 victory tonight over the Kansas City Scouts in the National Hockey League home opener for the victors.

title: Infuriated Losers Blame The Umpire
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 14To say the Red Sox were angry tonight would be an understatement. They were viciously angry, enough probably to throttle an umpire if he walked into their clubhouse.

title: Sports Today
description: World Series, fourth game. Reds vs. Boston Red Sox, at Cincinnati. (TelevisionChannel 4, 8:30 P.M.) (RadioWNWSFM, 8:15 P.M.).

title: State Police Association SeeksAttica Defense Appropriation
description: The New York State Police Benevolent Association called on the Legislature and Govertor Carey yesterday to appropriate money for the defense of troopers indicted on charges connected with the 1971 Attica prison uprising.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: State Senator Anthony Imperiale. Independent of Essex County, who once wrestled a baby gorilla, is licking his woundsall 29 of themafter an unexpected bout with lion. Duke, a tame lion rented from Jungle Habitat accompany Mr. Imperiale in a Columbus Day parade, became jittery after hearing a dog bark and started clawing and biting the Senator's legs and arms.

title: British Football
description: ??ley 1, Liverpool 0.

title: GROUP PLANS WAY TO PRESS BUSING
description: Some of the leading proponents of school desegregation in the United States met here yesterday to plan strategy against what was seen as growing public resistance to busing in Northern cities and an ebbing of a commitment to desegregation on the part of some blacks.

title: Puerto Rico Seeks Way Out As Economic Woes Mount
description: SAN JUAN, P. R.The 25 years of industrial growth under Operation Bootstrap, which some observers considered to have transformed Puerto Rico from an area of neglect into a success symbol for the developing world, have come to a close.

title: Prize Cites Pioneering Of Analysis
description: One of the basic ingredients in an economic analysis of the functioning of an industrial economy  organized either along capitalist or Communist linesis a complete description of the productive techniques available to the economy at a given moment of time. Prior to the development of activity analysis, the analytical technique recognized in the Stockholm announcement, it was customary to summarize this knowledge by means of a complex series of production functions or relationships.

title: BARRY GENSLER
description: Barry Gensler, president of the Barry Electronics Corporation of this city, was drowned with his associate, Ren Ouvrard, when their cabin cruiser was wrecked on Long Island Sound Sunday evening. Mr. Gensler, a wellknown radio ham, and Mr. Ouvrard were each 52 years old and both lived at 25 Sutton Place.

title: Concert
description: Sylvia Marlowe is an honored veteran among harpsichordists, above all for the new works she has commissioned and her performing collaborations with other artists. But in inaugurating a threeconcert series entitled Sylvia Marlowe and Friends on Monday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, Miss Marlowe played a classic of the harpsichord repertory all by herself, and the results weren't very satisfactory.

title: Stocks Off 2.52 After Early Rise
description: The stock market's encouraging climb that began on Monday kept going early yesterday, and then it fizzled. The Dow Jones industrial average, which showed a gain of 8.66 points at 2 P.M., lost all that and closed at 835.25, down 2.52 points from Monday. There was no convincing reason for the downturn.

title: FORD URGES SHIFT IN U.S. DOG FIGHT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14President Ford released today, white paper on drug abuse calling for concentration of Federal drug control efforts on substances that pose the greatest risk to users and lower priority enforcement against less destructive drugs, includfag mariivana.

title: Kissinger in Canada For Talks on Energy
description: OTTAWA, Oct. 14 (Reuters)Secretary of State Kissinger arrived here today for a twoday visit during which energy topics were expected to be the main points of discussion.

title: 3 Universities Begin A Plan to Increase Minority Students
description: BOSTON, Oct. 14The graduate schools of arts and sciences at Harvard, Yale and Princeton universities have agreed to exchange the names of minority applicants to increase the enrollment of such students.

title: JEROME A. MONASCH
description: Jerome A. Monasch, who re tired in 1973 as chairman of the Lehman Brothers Corporation, paint manufacturer, died Monday at Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 77 years old and lived at 21 East 87th Street.

title: PRESEASON BASKETBALL
description: New York (ABA) 122, Washington (NBA) 114.

title: Quinlan Guardian Believes Coma Is Not Irreversible
description: MORRISTOWN, Oct. 14The courtappointed guardian representing Karen Anne Quinlan, the young woman who has been in a coma for six months, urged Superior Court here today to reject her parents request to disconnect the respirator that sustains her. He also disputed connections that her coma was irreversible.

title: MIXED PATH TAKEN BY PRICES ON AMEX
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange closed mixed yesterday as many traders appeared confused over the economic situation. However, prices advanced in the overthecounter market in heavy trading.

title: Commonwealth Edison Has 3.1% Rise in Net Income
description: The Commonwealth Edison Company, one of the major electric companies in the Midwest, reported yesterday a 3.1 per cent increase in its 1975 third quarter net income cornpared with that of a year ago.

title: New Books
description: Contemporary American Folk Artists, by Elinor Lander Horwitz, J. Roderick Moore, consultant, with photographs by Joshua Horwitz (Lippincott, $7.50; paperbound. $2.95).

title: Dr. Clark Is Honored for Roles As a Professor and Protagonist
description: The New York Civil Liberties Union honored Dr. Kenneth B. Clark, the psychologist and civilrights advocate, at a dinner last night marking his retirement earlier this year from his posts at City College and the Metropolitan Applied Research Center.

title: City Stores Seen Acquisition Target
description: Julio Tanjeloff, owner of Astro Minerals, Ltd., and of Georg Jensen will soon make a bid to acquire control of the City Stores Company, the parent concern of Franklin Simon, W. & 1. Sloane, Inc., and a number of leading department. stores in the East and South, according to reliable sources yesterday.

title: Reds Win in 10 Innings, 65
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 14It may not be as small, angled or strangely shaped as Fenway Park, but Riverfront Stadium became a homerun hitter's haven tonight as the Cincinnati Reds defeated the Boston Red Sox, 65, in 10 innings and took a 21 lead in the 72d World Series.

title: FORD AIDES SEEK TO MODIFY LAWS ON SPYING METHOD
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14The Ford Administration has become convinced that a significant part of the National Security Agency's, foreign intelligence gathering, though vital, may be of questionable legality and it has devised plan by which it hopes to continue such operations while protecting the rights of Americans, according to highly olaced Administration sources.

title: Cash Prices
description: Tuesday, Oct 14, 1975.

title: Concert: Nylaard Conducts Schubert
description: The best can be the enemy of the next best. Masterpieces invite the attention of musicians to the exclusion of works that are only very good. This is the case, to a large extent, with Schubert's music. The greatest of his symphonies, songs, sonatas and chamber works are played frequently, while the rest of his compositions are pretty well neglected.

title: Paper in Moscow Likens Sakharov To Laboratory Rat
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 14 (UPI)In one of the sharpest attacks on Andrei D. Sakharov since he won the 1975 Nobel Peace Prize last Thursday, the Soviet newspaper Literatuntaya Gazeta today accused the Russian physicist of supporting Nazi and Fascist causes and likened him to a laboratory rat.

title: Is Monetarism Too Costily?
description: Thomas Huxley, the 19thcentury English biologist, once bemoaned the fate of a beauItiful theory killed by a nasty, ugly little fact. Is that fate about to overtake the economic theory known as monetarism? The Economic principal tenet of Analysis monetarism is in the words of its most celebrated modern champion, Prof. Milton Friedman of the University of Chicago, that inflation is at all times and everywhere a monetary phenomenon.

title: BEAME TO DETAIL ADDITIONAL CUTS; NEW LAYOFFS SEEN
description: Governor Carey and otner members of the Emergency Financial Control Board summoned Mayor Beame to a private meeting yesterday and, after reportedly indicating displeasure with the pace of his budgetcutting plans, heard him agree to present greater details today in meeting a state mandate to impose $200million in fresh budget cuts.

title: Stage: A Canadian Billy in Brooklyn
Craftsmen Losing Major Showcase
description: The Fairtree Gallery, the largest gallery in New York devoted exclusively to the exhibition and sale of crafts, will close its doors permanently on Jan. 31. Steady losses and lack of further funding were given as the reasons.

title: Lobby for Hoover Reportedly Spied On Congressmen
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14 (AP) The Federal Bureau of Inves igation lent agents to Congres sional staffs to lobby on behall of the late j. Edgar Hoover, then the F.B.I. director, and the agents, in turn, reported back on the personal lives of Congressmen, The Washington Post reported today.

title: Survie Apres Babel: I
description: Dans une scne pour nous frappante et limpide du film 2001 par M. Stanley Kubrick, une sorte de P.D.G. (autpnt qu'il nous en sonvienne) s'approche d'un crancommunicateur, emet son message complexe, ce qui est traduit instantanment en russe par un o'dinateur invisible, et transmis a un interlocuteur lointain.

title: Computer Finds the Average Person, But Madame France Isn't Impressed
description: PARIS, Oct. 14Once upon a time a young girl named Jeanette lived in a small town in northern France.

title: PILLSBURY SEEKS TOTINO'S FOODS
description: The Pillsbury Company of Minneapolis said yesterday it had agreed in principle to acquire Totino's Finer Foods. Inc., for about $20.2million in Pillsbury common stock. Totino's a maser or rrozen pizzas based in Fridley, Minn., had earnings of $1.3million on sales of $38million in the year to Oct. 31. Pillsbury said the acquisition would be accounted for on a poolingofinterest basis and is expected to have a modest positive effect on Pillsbury's fiscal 1976 earnings.

title: New for Produce Shoppers Lessons on the Plastic Bags
description: The A. A. P. is performing plastic surgery intended to put bags under its customers eyes.

title: One Count Dropped Against Appraiser Of Nixon's Papers
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 14 (AP)  A conspiracy charge against Ralph G. Newman, accused of plotting to backdate former President Richard H. Nixon's personal papers to give him tax break, has been dropped at the request of the Watergate special prosecutor's office.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Tjalling C. Koopmans of Yale and Leonid V. Kantorovich of the Soviet Union will share the Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Science. The announcement by the Swedish Royal Academy of Science said they were cited for their contribution to the theory of optimum allocation of resources, leading to improved economic planning. The two men conducted broadly similar work, largely independent of each other but with some contact in the last 20 years. [Page 1, Column 1.].

title: Schools in Nyack Open Despite Teachers Strike
description: NYACK, N. Y., Oct. 14Schools will stay open for 3,700 schoolchildren here despite a strike called this morning by 90 per cent of the teachers in the district, according to Dr. John B. Sommi, the Nyack school superintendent.

title: A U.S. Artist Performs In Cuba, First Since 61
description: HAVANA, Oct. 14 (Reuters) The cellist Christine Walevska last night became the first American artist to perform in Cuba since relations with the United States were broken 14 years ago.

title: N.B.A. Frees Wilt
description: Larry O'Brien, commissioner of the National Basketball Association, declared Wilt Chamberlain a free agent yesterday and Mike Burke, president of the Knicks, planned to fly to Los Angeles today with Eddie Donovan, the club's general manager, to meet with the 7foot2inch center.

title: Business Briefs
description: BRUSSSELS, Oct. 14 (UPI)The dollar made sharp gains on major European money markets today. Gold prices fell. In Zurich, gold slipped to $140.75 an ounce, against yesterday's closing price of $142. In London, the metal lost 75 cents to close at $141. In London, the pound lost ground against the dollar, dropping to $2.0475 from yesterday's closing of $2.06125.

title: 4 MURDER SUSPECT FREES 3 HOSTAGES
description: KINGS BEACH, Calif. Oct. 14 (UPI)  A heavily armed former United States Marine suspected of robbing a bank and killing a Nevada policeman took three hostages at a lake Tahoe resort today but freed them after negotiating with the Police.

title: Professional Football
description: Professional Football.

title: SYRIA WON'T ATTEND PARLEY ON LEBANON
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Oct. 14 (Reuters)Syria announced tonight that she would not attend the Arab foreign ministers conference on the Lebanese crisis in Cairo tomorrow.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: Eric Steinberg recently began commuting on the Long Island Railroad from his home in Cedarhurst, L. L. to his job in Manhattan as a magician in the adult department at Macy's. One morning, he discovered that he had left his weekly commuhome, and therefore had to spend $2 to buy a ticket on the train from the conductor. The next day, he presented the receipt and his unpunched commutation ticket to the conductor and asked for a refund.

title: Phone Company To Provide Scores
description: The New York Telephone Company will provide World Series scores on Sports Phone. The number is 9991313.

title: A Fine Corinth Opens Met Season
description: For a company that had spent the last couple of months teetering on the brink of default, so to speak, the Metropolitan Opera looked and sounded thoroughly healthy Monday night when it opened its season with Rossini's The Siege of Corinth. With Beverly Sills in splendid vonce and Shirley Verrett standing up to her idolized colleague and then some, the performance took shape as one of the most successful first nights at the Met in many a season.

title: Court Permits Suit For F.B.I. Inquiry On Student's Letter
description: PHILADELPHIA. Oct. 14 (AP)  A New Jersey teenager won the right to sue the Federal Government today because Federal agents had investigated he after she wrote a letter to leftwing political party as school project.

title: Mountbatten Here On a New Crusade
description: Earl Mountbatten or Burma, the peer who helped rout the juggernauts of Germany and Japan and who then went on to preside over the dismantling of the British Empire, was discoursing on the gravest of topicsWorld War II and its political aftermath.

title: Japanese Imperial Art Details Rich Past
description: After the Disneyland caper and sundry other excursions by Emperor Hirohito into the arcana of American popular culture, it will no doubt come as something of a relief to aficionados of traditional Japanese art to learn that this precious esthetic treasure was not entirely overlooked on the monarch's historic journey to the United States.

title: High Court Declines To Review Decision On Gas Purchasing
description: WASHINGTON, Oct: 14 (AP) The Supreme Court declined today to review a decision that the Federal Power Commission said had hampered its efforts to meet critical shortages of natural gas.

title: Danny Kaye Awarded U.N.'s Peace Medal
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 14  Danny Kaye collected a peace medal today from Secretary General Waldheim and then politely but firmly removed himself from consideration for a diplomatic career.

title: Bombs in Argentina Damage A Restaurant and 2 Homes
description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 14 (UPI)Four bombs exploded in and around the Argentine capital today, causing considerable damage but no injuries, the police reported.

title: ABC to Replace A. M. America With Good Morning Magazine
description: ABCTV said yesterday that it would replace the early morning news and variety show A.M. America, with a new magazinetype program, Good Morning, America, beginning Nov. 3. It will have as its host David Hartman, a television actor who last year had the title role in NBC's Lucas Tann Pr.

title: Democrats Adopt Measure Curbing Convention Debates
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14 (UPI) After being told there was a tragic pattern of loss to Republicans in 1968 and 1972, he Democratic National Cornmittee voted today to dampen the kind of wideopen debate that has tied up and split its national conventions.

title: Fiscal Crisis Linked To Job Losses Here
description: The realization that economic decline is at the root of New York's troubles  that too much spending, which has been blamed for the city's fiscal plight, is another way of saying too little incomehas been growing slowly in recent months and now is emerging as a consensus among business and government leaders.

title: Jordan Buys U.S. Wheat
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Oct. 14 (AP)Jordan and the United States have signed an agreement for Jordan to buy 40,000 tons of American wheat for $6.1million. The wheat will be paid for with a loan repayable over 20 years at 2 per cent interest for two years and per cent thereafter.

title: Receipts for Sales Tax in State Slip Below Budget for the Yew
description: TRENTON, Oct. 14 (AP)State sales tax receipts have slipped further behind what was budgeted for the fiscal year, the Treasury Department. said today's.

title: People in Sports
description: With Belinda Ali standing at his side, Muhammad Ali told critics yesterday not to believe everything they read in the newsoaners.

title: U.N. FactFinders Ask Consultation On Spanish Sahara
description: UNITED NATIONS. Oct. 14 (AP)A United Nations group recommended today that the General Assembly act to enable. the people of the Spanish Sa hara, a disputed territory in northwestern Africa, to decide their own future through constilation under U.N. auspices.

title: UNTESTED MISSILE INFLUENCES TALKS
description: A new longrange missile, which the Department of Defense hopes will he tested next year, is already influencing armslimitation talks with the Soviet Union and Soviet strategic calculations, United States and European military analysts say.

title: BOOK THEFT IS LAID TO A COLUMBIA DEAN
description: An assistant dean of students at Columbia College was charged yesterday with stealing a rare edition of Milton's Paradise Lost from an East Side book shoo.

title: Arms Grants May End
description: Big majorities or two Congressional committees have agreed to phase out the program of direct United States armsaid grants over the next two to three years. Page 13.

title: KENNECOTT REQUEST ON DIVESTING DENIED
description: The United States Court of Appeals for the 10th Circuit in Denver has denied a request by the Kennecott Copper Corporation for extension of an Oct. 1 deadline for filing a specific plan for divesting itself of the Peabody Coal Company, the nation's largest coal producer.

title: John Briscoe, Dairy Farmer And English Instructor, 72
description: John D. Briscoe, a retired dairy farmer and former instructor of English at Radcliffe, Harvard and the University of Wisconsin, died of cancer Friday in Sharon (Conn.) Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived in Lakeville, Conn.

title: Waltemade Asks Special Court To Bypass Referee's Findings
description: ALBANY. Oct. 14The lawyer for Supreme Court Justice Wilfred A. Waltemade urged today that the state's special disciplinary court disregard report by a courtappointed referee who found the Bronx justice's behavior on the bench so rude and abusive that it constituted judicial misconduct.

title: News Broadcasts
description: All News: WCBS, WINS, WNWS. Hourly on the Hour. WQXR, WNBC, WNEWAM, WOR, WSOU.

title: Catholic Churchgoing Off
description: BOSTON, Oct. 14 (AP)The Roman Catholic Church's restrictions on birth control and divorce and the authority of the Pope are the main reasons why fewer Catholics are going to church, according to a national churchsponsored study.

title: Russian and Americanw in Nobel Award in Economics
description: STOCKHOLM, Oct. 14,Leonid V. Kantorovich of the Soviet. Union and Tjalling C. koopmans of Yale University were named by the Swedish Royal Academy of Science today as cowinners of the 1975 Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Science.

title: Ford Confers With Haig
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14 (Reuters)President Ford conferred at the White House today with Gen. Alexander M. Haig, the Supreme Commander in Europe. The White House said General Haig briefed the President on military affairs but issued no further statement.

title: Birth Control Pills Are Recalled Due to Drop in Level of Estrogen
description: RARITAN, N. J., Oct. 14 (AP) The Ortho Pharmaceutical Corporation here has recalled its Modicon birth control pills after tests showed that the level of estrogen, the active ingredient, had decreased in a small number of the pills.

title: Greece's Sandwich Isles
description: PARISAs the United States again explores possibilities of settling the savage argument between Greece and Turkey, it would help to avoid errors if Washington acknowledged the profound change in the psychological re, lationships of its East Mediterranean allies.

title: Richard Tucker Is Honored at St. Patrick's
description: Richard Tucker, the MetroFolitan Opera tenor who died ast January, was remembered for his talent and his great humanity yesterday at what was believed to be the first memorial mass for a Jew at St. Patrick's Cathedral.

title: About New York
description: Beckie Solomon, who wasn't really sure that she needed to see again, has had her vision back for almost year now and, on the whole, she is thankful for it.

title: CHINA DENOUNCES U. S. ON TIBETANS
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 14China accused the United States today of supporting Tibetans who seek to restore the exiled Dalai Lama to power in Tibet, which the Chinese Communists control.

title: Angolan Nationalist Leader Rules Out Pact With Rivals
description: LUANDA. Angola, Wednesday, Oct. 15 (Agence FrancePresse)Dr. Agostinho Neto, president of the Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola, said here yesterday that his movement would proclaim the independence of Angola within a few weeks come what may. Angola is dtie to get its independence from Portugal on Nov. 11.

title: U.S. Rejects Complaints
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14The State department rejected China's complaint today about the activities of Tibetan exiles.

title: Tjalling C. Koopmans
description: Early yesterday morning, in Hamden, Conn.. Tjalling Charles Koopmans, a bearded, Dutchborn Yale professor, stepped into the limelight as cowinner of the 1975 Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Science. Telephone calls from the press had awakened him at 7 A.M. with the news from Stockholm. The calls were soot followed by reporters who appeared on his doorstep with notebooks and tape recorders. The tall, thin professor, who retains a slight hint of Dutch accent, greeted the early arrivals in his bathrobe.

title: Fiscal Crisis Linked To Job Losses Here
description: The realization that economic decline is at the root of New York's troubles  that too much spending, which has been blamed for the city's fiscal plight, is another way of saying too little incomehas been growing slowly in recent months and now is emerging as a consensus among business and government leaders.

title: Saudis Back OilPrice Freeze Until 77
description: BONN, Oct. 14Saudi Arabia favors freezing the oil price recently agreed upon by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries until the end of 1976, Saudi Arabia's Minister of Petroleum, Sheik Ahmed Zaki Yamani, said here today.

title: Grain Prices Rise On Soviet Rumors Sugar Futures Ease
description: Following weak early prices which followed through from Monday, grain and soybean prices moved up yesterday and closed slightly higher on the Chicago Board of Trade. December wheat gained 7 cents a bushel, December corn, 4 cents, and January soybeans  cent.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Political and Security Committee  10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Auto Sales Rose 12.7% in the First 10 Days of October
description: DETROIT. Oct. 14Strong sales of 1976 models sent American new car sales for the first 10 days of October 12.7 per cent above figures for the same period last year. It was only the second time in 1975 that sales topped the yearago level.

title: Big John Hits The Road
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14  John Connally of Texas will be touring the country for the next sixty days, and to hear him tell it, this is sort of a meditative journey to ponder the great issues of the nation and educate the People on his ways of thinking.

title: Ford Is Uninjured as His Car Is Hit in Hartford
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 14President Ford's bulletproof limousine was struck broadside by an automobile in downtown Hartford just before 10 o'clock tonight after he spoke at a Republican fundraising dinner.

title: Detroit Deadline Extended
description: DETROIT, Oct. 14 (UPI)United States District Judge Robert Demascio extended today the Detroit school board deadline to submit final revisions in a school integration plan. Judge Demascio said the plan must be presented to him tomorrow, instead of today.

title: Yonkers Raceway Results
description: Yonkers Raceway Results.

title: Living in Sinai Zone Dull but Dangerous
description: UNITED NATIONS BUFFER ZONE, Sinai, Oct. 8The Swedish major kept a tight grip on his seat as the jeep bucked wildly through the rolling sand dunes and jerked to a halt. Just ahead a red sign dangling from a rusting coil of barbed wire warned in Hebrew and Arabic: Danger mines!.

title: FORD TAX DECISION WAS MADE IN JULY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14The White House said today that President Ford made a basic though tentative decision in July to propose that a 1976 tax cut be coupled with a ceilInv on Federal svendine.

title: Massachusetts Acts to Cut New Hampshire Sales Gain
description: BOSTON, Oct. 14 (AP)The Massachusetts House has admitted for consideration a latefiled bill to allow stores to open Sundays.

title: Airline Mediation Rejected
description: MIAMI, Oct. 14 (UPI)Striking flight attendants for National Airlines overwhelmingly rejected last night proposals calling for a new attempt by Federal mediators to resolve a sixweekold walkout. About 450 strikers attending a membership meeting shouted down a motion asking the National Mediation Board to prepare a new compromise proposal to setle the strike. The same resolution would have bound negotiators for the Association of Flight Attendants to submit to the membership the most favorable contract proposal offered.

title: Welch Is Medalist In NorthSouth Golf
description: PINEHURST, N.C., Oct. 14 (UPI)Harry Welch of Salisbury shot a oneunderpar 71 today and won medalist honors for the 24th annual North and South senior invitation golf championship.

title: Kibbee Proposes 20% Cut In Scope of City Universiti
description: Robert J. Kibbee, the chancellor of the City University, has sent to the Board of Higher Education a farranging set of proposals for restructuring the university to cut its scale of operations by 20 ner cent.

title: News Summary and Index
description: In sharp contrast to Secretary of State Kissinger's expressed confidence in the outcome of the talks with the Soviet Union on strategic arms limitations, several authoritative Administration officials say the talks are in trouble. Among the unresolved issues that some believe are of firstorder importance are the Soviet Backfire bomber, the American airbreathing cruise missile and the definition of a large missile. Some of these issues arose because they were not properly considered at the Vladivostok negotiations last November. [Page 1, Col. 5.].

title: Byrne Says He Will Sign Open Public Meetings Bill
description: TRENTON, Oct. 15 Governor. Byrne announced today that he would sign a bill that would open to the public most meetings or government at the local, county and state levels.

title: An Editor Without Panache Finds He Has Many Friends
description: Kenneth D. McCormick, the senior consultant editor at Doubleday, hates big parties, but yesterday he went to one anyway. He had to; the party was for him.

title: Red Sox Beat Reds, 54, to Tie Series at 2 Games Each
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 15With one of the liveliest disputes in the 72year history of the World Series in the background, Luis Tiant took center stage tonight and pitched Boston to a 54 triumph over Cincinnati that put the Red Sox on even terms with the Reds after four games.

title: Snow in North Dakota
description: FARGO, N. D., Oct. 15 (AP)The latest snowfall in North Dakota has ended after dropping up to seven inches of new snow over the western portions Of the state, the National Weather Service said today.

title: MRS. PERON BACK IN BUENOS AIRES
description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 15 President Isabel Martinez de Peron returned here today from a fiveweek leave of absence despite efforts by most political factions to persuade her to step down.

title: Shipping/Mails
Books of The Times
description: About five years ago, the reawakened feminist movement announced a war on rape, but the declaration seemed about as practical as affirming the benignity of sunlight. Well, of course, one muttered to oneself, rape is awful, deplorable, an unalloyed tarnish on the human condition. But so are cancer, forest fires, and the sundry other disasters that people have been heir to ever since they evolved from whatever species preceded them. What could one possibly do about rape, except to deplore it? And what, aside from the fact that most perpetrators of rape are male (though their victims are not necessarily female) does rape really have to do with women's liberation? One might as plausibly wage war on murder under the banner of human liberation. Would some one be kind enough to explain? Well, at long last, in her exhaustive and detailed study, Against Our Will: Men, Women and Rape, the journalist and feminist Susan Brownmiller has attempted to. explain, and by degrees one grasps what she is driving at, what all who have made rape an issue of feminism are driving at. But only by slow degrees does one grasp it.

title: Pornography Case Due
description: MORRISTOWN, Oct. 15 (UPI) A jury is expected to begin deliberations tomorrow here in a pornography case that resulted from the first raid in New Jersey conducted after a ban was lifted on enforcement of the state's antiobscenity statutes. In 1972, New Jersey's obscenity law was declared unconstitutional. The state then passed another statute, allowing county prosecutors to determine enforcement of obscenity.

title: BERME SUBMITS NEW CUTS REQUIRING ADDED LAYOFFS RUNNING INTO THOUSANDS
description: With bitter complaint and a caution to city residents to retain their grace under pressure, Mayor Beame submitted yesterday to a state austerity mandate and proposed fresh budget cuts totaling $200.7million that, he said, would further shrink city services and force additional layoffs in the thousands.

title: Delayed First Women's Bank Opening Set
description: The carpenters were still at work yesterday and some of the desks and other staff facilities semed makeshift, but the chances appeared good that the First Women's Bank would open today after a series of delays lasting more than a year.

title: Deaths
HARTFORD POLICE TAKE CRASH BLAME
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 15The Hartford Police Department took the blame today for the traffic accident here last night involving President Ford's limousine. The President was not injured.

title: Barnett Slept Good After Call
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 15Larry Barnett, the umpire involved in last night's controversial 10thinning bunt play. said tonight it was the toughest call he has ever had to make but he would make it the same way again.

title: Plungers Have Their Day At BlueChip Horse Auction
description: A man named Jones set a world record by buying a horse for $730,000 at Belmont Park yesterday, and then said in all earnestness, I'm obviously very pleased with the price.

title: About the Giants
description: Three players did not work out yesterday because injuries, but only one is a doubtful starter for Monday night's game against Buffalo. He is Steve Crosby, secondyear running back, who has a sprained ankle. Doug Van Horn, offensive tackle with an ailing calf muscle, is listed as questionable and John Mendenhall, defensive tackle, is still nursing a sore ankle. Both should be ready to play. Don Herrmann, wide receiver placed on unrecallable waivers, has not been picked up by San Francisco, a 49er spokesman said. It could not be learned if other clubs would try to obtain him. Willie Young, offensive tackle who suffered a pinched nerve in his neck, worked out and appeared to be all right.

title: The Trade That Stabilized the Reds
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 15Between drinks at the World Series, where memories invariably lengthen in direct proportion to the reduction of whisky in the glass, two oldtimers were arguing the identity of baseball's most celebrated slave dealer.

title: Mercantile Merger Approved
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 15 (AP)A plan to merge the Chicago Mercantile Exchange, the second largest commodity futures market in the world, with the International Monetary Market was approved unanimously today by the boards of both exchanees.

title: MUSICLESS MOVES DANCED BY JOFFREY
description: Jerome Robbins's Moves, which the City Center Joffrey Ballet gave Tuesday night at the City Center for the first time this season, remains a curiosity because it is danced to no music.

title: 48 Sailors File Suit
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Oct. 15 (UPI)Fottr dozen sailors based at the Mayport Naval Station have joined a classaction suit for a promised reenlistment bonus or discharge from the navy. The original suit filed last month by five sailors from the Mayportbased U.S.S. Patterson was amended yesterday to include 43 additional sailors stationed aboard five more Mayportbased vessels.

title: Banks Agree to Some Aid In Current City Shortfall
description: City fiscal officials won a partial commitment from savings banks yesterday to make up a shortfall on immediate borrowing requirements, but they found themselves $56million short as they faced a deadline tomorrow for producing the needed cash.

title: Maritime. Commission Is Asked By Gibson to Remain in Newark
description: NEWARK, Oct. 15Mayor Kenneth A. Gibsor today asked Helen Delich Bentley, chairman of the Federal Maritime Commission, to reconsider her decision to close the agency's offices here.

title: Inventories Grow Ford Is Optimistic
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15United States business added to inventories in August after six months of massive inventory liquidation, providing further strong evidence of recovery in the economy, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Lowry to Direct Arts Study
description: W. McNeil Lowry, who retired last year from the Ford Foundation as its vice president for the humanities and the arts, will direct a study of the arts in the United States under the auspices of the American Council of Learned Societies. Robert M. Lumiansky, the council's president, said the threeyear project, culminating in a hook, will be supported by a $270,917 grant from the Ford Foundation. Emphasis will be on the 20th century.

title: New Bond Issues
Swede Risberg, Player Barred In Black Sox Scandal, Dead
description: Charles (Swede) Risberg, one of eight baseball players barred for life in the 1919 Chicago Black Sex scandal, died at a convalescent home in Red Bluff, Calif., on Monday, his 81st birthday.

title: Film Reportedly Contains Fugitives Account of 71 Capitol Bombing
description: A controversial documentary film about the radical Weather Underground organization contains footage of the violent fugitive group's top leadership and their account of the bombing of the United States Capitol on March 1, 1971, according to an interview with the filmmaker, Emile. de Antonio, published by Rolling Stone magazine.

title: Jewelry Makers Find Hobby Can Make a Profit
description: Their jewelry making began as a lark. Less than five years ago Sylvia Agostini, Carolee Russack, Sandy Baker and Eva Graham were hobbyists designing necklaces earrings, bracelets and other baubles for themselves and their friends, just for fun. Today they are running small but solid jewelry outlets that do business in six figures annually, selling to department stores, specialty shops and boutiques across the country. Their success, the buyers say, is partly because of changes in consumers buying habits and tastes. Women today are buying their own jewelry and they want something they won't see on everybody else. It is just this. kind of jewelrycustommade, oneofakind piecesthat these small personal businesses make.

title: Atlanta School Employes Back To Work Under a Court Order
description: Striking teachers and nonteaching school employes returned to the job under court order yesterday in Atlanta, while striking teachers and school officials reached tentative agreement in Salt Lake City.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: FOOTLIGHT SALUTE That charming old comedy The Pursuit of Happiness, a Broadway hit in 1934, won equally good reviews as a movie the same year (costarring Joan Bennett and Francis Lederer) and the property would seem to have vanishedat least until tonight. A revival of the play by Armina Marshall and Lawrence Langner, two founders of the Theater Guild, will open the 33d season of the Equity Library Theater at 8 o'clock, at Riverside Drive and 103d Street.

title: Midwest Farmers Harvest Big Grain Crop and Wait for Russians
description: JEFFERSON, Iowa, Oct. 13All day long and long after dark, Middlewestern farmers (were rushing this week to gather in their share of a bumper corn and soybean crop. But, while they did so, they were angrily waiting for the Russians.

title: PACT WITH SOVIET ON MISSILE CURBS REPORTED IN PERIL
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15Several authoritative Administration officials say the talks with the Soviet Union on strategic arms limitations are in trouble.

title: Verdict Reversal Asked

title: AntiZionist Resolution Gains in U.N
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 15A United Nations committee seemed tonight to be inching toward adoption of an Arabinspired resolution equating Zionism with racial discrimination.
