description: Kessinger of Cubs Is Traded to Cards

title: Sadat Effort to Attract U.S. Investors Slowed by Red Tape, Egyptian Style
description: President Anwar elSadat of Egypt arrives in New York today to press his case for more American business investment in that country. But American businessmen noted that, despite two years of an avowed open door policy in Egypt, not a single major investment had been announced.

title: U.S. Equal Credit Act To Take Effect Today
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (UPI)Bankers and creditors will be legally bound tomorrow for the first time against using many practices that discriminate against women borrowers.

title: TongueLashing of Jurors By Judge Is Under Inquiry
description: The tonguelashing a State Supreme Court justice gave a jury that acquitted a defendant charged with murder has led to an investigation by the Temporary State Commission on Judicial Conduct.

title: Saint Out a Month
description: ST. PAUL, Oct. 28 (UPI)Gary Gambucci, a center for the Minnesota Fighting Saints, lost sonic cartilage off his rib cage in a game with San Diego last Thursday and will be out of action for about one month, the World Hockey Association club said today.

title: ROLF NESCH
description: OSLO, Norway, Oct. 28 (AP) Rolf Nesch, a leading graphic artist and winner of several international awards, died here today at tne age of 83.

title: Appraiser Goes on Trial in the Alleged Backdating of Nixon Papers
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 28Ralph G. Newman, a bibliophile and expert on the written memorabilia of Abraham Lincoln, went on trial in Federal District Court here today on charges stemming from his appraisal of the value of papers belonging to President Nixon that were used for tax deduction purposes.

title: Treasures of Tutankhamen to Start 6City Tour in 76 at National Gallery
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28An exhibition of 53 treasures from the tomb of the Egyptian Pharaoh Tutankhamen, 19 of which have never before left Egypt, will go on display at the National Gallery of Art here in late November, 1976. It will be the start of a sixcity tour in the United States that will wind up at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York in 1978.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Bulls 101, Sonics 90
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 28 (AP)Bob Love and a reserve forward, Rowland Garrett, cornbined for 13 points in the fourth quarter tonight to lift the Chicago Bulls to a 10190 triumph over the previously unbeaten Seattle SuperSonics in an N.B.A. contest.

title: Proxmire and Stevenson Agree on City Aid Action
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 Senator William Proxmire, chairman of the Senate Banking Committee, and Senator Adlai E. Stevenson 3d of Illinois agreed today to a compromise that both supporters and opponents said assured the committee's narrow approval of a $4billion loanguarantee bill for New York City.

title: Closing of a Police Station Is Protested in Chinatown
description: Thousands of Chinatown residents, chanting in Cantonese and English marched to City Hall yesterday to protest a proposal to close the Fifth Precinct station house.

title: WINE TALK
description: SAN FRANCISCO There is one in Beaune, France. There is one at Bully Hill, N. Y. There are several in Germany and there is the magnificent one at Chateau MoutonRothschild. Wine museums, of course. But there are none like the Wine Museum here in the heart of America's wine country, the repository of the Christian Brothers Collection.

title: Taser, HighVoltage Dart Gun, Declared Dangerous
description: Police Commissioner Michael J. Codd warned yesterday that the Taser, a highvoltage dart gun, had been classified as a dangerous weapon under the state's Sullivan Law.

title: BusinessCycle Politics
description: Is the business cycle really politicalthat is, a creature of electionyear and offyear politics? President Ford's proposal for a $28billion tax cut on Jan. 1. to be followed nine months later by a $28billion spending cut, has been criticized not only by his political opponents but even by some of his conservative supporters as a plan for jazzing up the economy in an election year and then trying to cut off the inflationary fallout after the election.

title: 3 PLEAD GUILTY IN FRAUD SCHEME
description: Podiatrist, 2 Chiropractors Charged With False Claims

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Morocco Responds With Fervor to Appeal for Sahara March
description: MARRAKESH, Morocco, Oct. 28The court of King Hassan II has succeeded in rousing the rural and humble population of this nation of 17 million to a fever pitch of fervor for the march that is intended to incorporate Spanish Sahara into Morocco.

title: Pappin to Join Seals
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oat. 28 (AP)Jim Pappin, a former Chicago Black Hawk who refused to report to the California Golden Seals after being traded in the offseason, agreed to terms today and will join the National Hockey League team next Sunday when the Seals play in Boston.

title: PRESIDENT NAMED GRANT CHAIRMAN
description: Robert H. Anderson, president And chief executive officer of the W. T. Grant Company, solidified his control of the distressed retail chain when the company's board yesterday accepted the resignations of two key officers. Mr. Anderson was also named chairman.

title: The Sad Tale of a Man In Search of a Wardrobe
description: My sin is that I am 42 years old, weigh 165 pounds, stand 5 feet 9 inches short and that I do not wish to look like Thomas Jefferson, or Hurd Hatfield when he played Dorian Gray, or even Johnny Carson.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Anthony Tassone, reputed head of the Trenton area underworld, was sentenced to 30 years in prison for his role in a 1972 robbeiy and kidnapping while he was in jail. Judge A. Jerome Moore, who handed down the sentence Superior Court, revoked Mr. Tassone's $50,000 bail and ordered him to begin serving the term immediately.

title: Byrne Is Ready to Give Post to Friend of Careys
description: TRENTON, Oct. 28As a favor to Governor Carey of New York and at the apparent insistence of high officials in the Carey administration, Governor Byrne is prepared to nominate a New Jersey friend of the Carey family to the Palisades Interstate Park Commission.

title: Open Interest
FORD TO PROPOSE BILL TO HELP CITY AFTER A DEFAULT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 President Ford will reportedly propose tomorrow that Congress enact legislation to assure the continuance of police and fire protection and other Vital services if New York City defaults.

title: Theater: Unadorned Thunder Rock
description: The Joseph Jefferson Theater Company, which is situated in the Little Church Around the Corner, is a little theater. The house is cozy, the stage is small and there is a feeling of community activity in the air. It is a neighborly theater. Productions are highly professional but basic and unadorned. Stripped of Broadway accoutrements, a play standsor fallson its own dramatic merits.

title: Democrats Raise $100,000
description: CLIFFSIDE PARK, Oct. 28 (AP)New Jersey Democrats cleared more than $100.000 on their $500ahead fundraising event here last night, according to James P. Dugan, the party's state chairman. Mr. Dugan said 240 persons attended the buffet in the Palisadium.

title: U.S. Steel Earnings Decline by 38.4% In the 3d Quarter
description: The United States Steel Corporation, the nation's largest steel producer, yesterday reported that its thirdquarter earnings had declined 38.4 per cent from the same period to $131.5million.

title: 2 Mistrial Motions Denied In Trial of S.L.A. Members
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 28 (UPI) A Superior Court judge has denied without comment two motions for a mistrial for two members of the selfstyled Symbionese Liberation Army, Russell Little and Joseph Remiro, who are being tried on charges of attempted murder.

title: FischerDieskau Sings Mahler With Much Zest
description: An entire program of Mahler's songs, such as the one given with unfailing success by Dietrich FischerDieskau at Carnegie Hall on Monday night, puts a singer's intelligence to an uncommon test. The German baritone selected 15 lieder from Des Knaben Wunderhorn, the anthology of poems on which Mahler drew for his texts. These are generally referred to as folk poems, but folklike would be more accurate, since they disclose such a high degree of sophistication that their origins in the dark past have be questioned.

title: 20 Cabbies Seek S. B. A. Loan To Save Business in Trenton
description: TRENTON. Oct, 28 (UPI)Twenty cabbies whose employer is going out of business will ask the Federal Government to back a $100,000 loan so they can take over the business, their lawyer said today.

title: About New York
description: The park that is Central to New York is such a draw that its curator, Henry Hope Read, hopes to persuade people that quiet pleasures are equally available in other parks all around the city.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: THE VILLAGE WAY To some New Yorkers, the annual antiques show at Greenwich House, the social settlement center at 27 Barrow Street, is a chance to scout vintage bargains and also explore the shifting scene in that downtown sector, with its basic tradition of Bohemia. More and more, the Greenwich House people are packaging their antiques assembly neighborhoodstyle with diversions in the same area.

title: Savings Accounts Said To Recover in October
description: Heavy withdrawals of money from savings accounts halted in early October in response to the decline in interest rates on alternate forms of investment, the Federal Home Loan Bank Board indicated yesterday.

title: COMPANY REPORTS
Schedule Favors Surging Dolphins
description: The National Football League's season reaches its halfway mark this weekend and there is a sneaky feeling here that the Miami Dolphins are on course toward another Super Bowl triumph, a course charted and steered by that master pilot, Don Shula. They have won five straight games after an opening loss to Oakland; their remaining schedule is breezy, and when the playoffs come, they could be operating on their home field, the Orange Bowl (where they hardly ever lose) right through the Super Bowl.

title: With Jobs Elsewhere Gone, 250,000 Go Back to Italy
description: MILAN. Italy, Oct. 28 (AP)About 250,000 Italian migrant workers returned home from West Germany and Switzerland in the first five months of this year as a result of the western European recession, the Italian Federation Of Migrant Workers has reported.

description: Monday evening, as the Museum of Modern Art opened its muchawaited exhibition. The Architecture of the Ecole des Beaux Arts, to invited guests, someone

description: Emile Francis, general manager of the floundering New York Rangers, made his first two moves yesterday in Operation Rescue:

title: Debenture Offer By Northwest Bell Is Set to Yield 9%
description: The Pacific Northwest Bell Telephone Company yesterday marketed $100million of new debentures priced to yield 9 per cent, a level that reflected the recent improvement in the corporate bond market. The new Bell offering, rated triple A, was won by underwriters headed by Blyth Eastman Dillon & Co. with bid of 99.326 for 9 per cent interest coupons. On the reoffering they were priced at par to yield 9 per cent.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Daley's Organization Bids Stevenson Run for President
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 28 (UPI)The executive committee of the Cook County Democratic party, the political organization of Mayor Richard J. Daley, voted unanimously today to urge Senator Adlai E. Stevenson 3d to run for President in 1976.

title: Swiss Bank Rate Cut
description: ZURICH, Switzerland, Oct. 28 (UPI)The Swiss National Bank lowered today Switzerland's bank rate by onehalf of one per cent point to 3 per cent, effective tomorrow. The Iombard rateloans secured by collateralwas reduced by the same margin to 4 per cent.

title: Schmidt Arrives in Peking; He Is Expected to See Mao
description: PEKING, Oct, 29 (Reuters)Chancellor Helmut Schmidt arrived here today on the first visit to China by a West German head of government.

title: Morgan Guaranty Set To Move Beirut Unit
description: The Morgan Guaranty Trust Company said yesterday it was moving its Middle East representative office from Beirut, Lebanon, to Amman, Jordan.

title: Bridge:
description: The Grand National Team Championship, now under way for the 197576 season, is probably the wor'd's biggest team contest. New Jersey and Westchester have now followed the example of New York City by beginning the competition at the grassroots level, allowing players to compete in their own club.

title: Humphrey Says City's Default Would Weaken U.S. Recovery
description: If New York City defaults, according to a hitherto unpublished Congressional study, the nation's economic recovery would he weakened, using even the most conservative assumptions, Senator Hubert H. Humphrey said here last night.

title: INQUIRY IS SOUGHT ON 5 STATE JUDGES
description: Five judges who committed serious improprieties face hearings to determine if they should be removed from the bench, a report of the Temporary State Commission on Judicial Conduct said yesterday.

title: AIDES FOR HOSPITAL ON L.I. BEGIN STRIKE

description: General in Air Strike Dispute Is Promoted

title: Carey Backs 3 Proposals For City Charter Revision
description: Governor Carey came out yesterday in favor of the first three proposals to revise the New York City Charterthose that would mandate fiscal and management reforms and would enhance the power of the City Council at the expense of the Mayor.

title: Beaths
description: ABOLAFIAVIctoria, beloved wife of the late Samuel, loving mother of Matty Weiss, Ros Friedman, and the late Bess Davidoff, dear grandmother and great grandmother. Services were held Tuesday, at Guttermans, Rockviile Center, L. I.

title: Interview in Kenya Angers Soviet Aide
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Oct. 28 (AP)A Soviet official quarreled so bitterly with Kenyan reporters that a taped interview, scheduled to be shown on state television, was canceled.

title: Ford Gets Disputed F.B.I. Plan For Nationwide Crime Center
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28A report on a plan by the Federal Bureau of Investigation to establish a nationwide criminal justice information communications system, which has been widely debated within the Government since this spring, has gone to President Ford, and a decision on the proposal may be near.

title: S.E.C. Spurns Proposal On Lockheed Bribe Data
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28The Securities and Exchange Commission rejected today a compromise proposal of a Federal judge that would have allowed the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation to provide the commission with information about its foreign bribes while insulating the information from disclosure under the Freedom of Information Act.

title: Labor Board Aide Named
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (AP) President Ford today nominated Peter D. Walther, Philadelphia lawyer, to be member of the National Labor Relations Board for a term expiring in 1980. He also nominated David W. Oberlin of Falls Church, Va., to be administrator of the St. Lawrence Seaway Development Corporation for term of seven years.

title: Amber (Get) Waves (Your) of (Plastic) Grain (Uncle Sam)
description: BENNINGTON, Vt.A month or so ago I had an allnight, relatively drunken conversation (I was drinking, not he) with an elevenyearold about Patriotism. He, I should mention, is one of your more brilliant elevenyearolds, a promising philosopher.

title: A.M.A. CRITICIZED ON CHIROPRACTIC
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28The staff of the House Oversight, and Investigation subcommittee has concluded that the campaign of the American Medical Association to eliminate chiropractic service in the United States may violate the antitrust laws.

description: The New York Stock Exchange will shortly make an offer to purchase Carlisle De Coppet & Co., the nation's last remaining odd  lot broker, James J. Needham, chairman of the exchange, said yesterday.

title: Councilman Steingut Accused of Payoffs
description: City Councilman Robert Steingut, son of Assembly Speaker Stanley Steingut, is under investigation by a Brooklyn grand jury on allegations that he promised jobs in exchange for campaign contributions, sources in the Brooklyn District Attorney's office disclosed yesterday.

description: City Councilman Robert Steingut, son of Assembly Speaker Stanley Steingut, is under investigation by a Brooklyn grand jury on allegations that he promised jobs in exchange for campaign contributions, sources in the Brooklyn District Attorney's office disclosed yesterday.

title: President Sadat's Visit
description: The first official visit of an Egyptian head of state Washington is an event of diplomatic significance; but it symbolizes neither the acceptance by the United States of President Sadat's views or policies, nor the repudiation in any sense of American friendship with Israel. It does represent the reestablishment of a tenuous working relationship between this country and the most Important of the Arab states in the threeway effort achieve a just and stable peace in the Middle East. Is in this context that President Sadat is here at the invitation of President Ford and of the United States Government.

title: WOMEN IN JERSEY FORGO STRIKE TODAY
description: TRENTON, Oct. 28 (UPI)A national strike by women scheduled tomorrow will not he observed in New Jersey because women will be working for the passage of the state's proposed Equal Rights Amendment, officials of the National Organization for Women said today.

title: JAPANESE FORESEE MAJOR FOOD CRISIS
description: TOKYO, Oct. 28The Minister of Agriculture and Forestry cautioned today that Japan was heading into a food crisis as severe as the oil crisis.

description: CLARKSTOWN, N.Y., Oct. 28 The bodies of two young women, both apparently in their 20's, were found last night and today, seven miles apart, in wooded areas of Rockland County.

title: U.S. AID HELD DIM FOR ROAD PROJECT
description: A high Federal transportation official indicated yesterday that prospects were dim for Federal financing of the citystate plan to construct a $1.3billion Interstate System superroad to replace the West Side Highway.

description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Wednesday, Oct. 29Armed men in downtown Parliament Square denounced the country's political leaders over a loudspeaker yesterday and then shot up the Chamber of Deputies, killing a deputy's bodyguard and wounding a gendarme.

description: LONDON, Oct. 28 (Reuters)Slater, Walker Securities, Ltd., said today it had appointed the accounting firms of Peat, Marwick, Mitchell & Co. and Price Waterhouse & Co. to prepare jointly a full review of the group to assist the board in its planning of the future direction of the group.

title: OIL DEALERS FAVOR CONTROL S??ENSION
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28An organization representing New England heatingoil distributors strongly recommended today that the Government suspend oil price controls and supply allocation rules for heating oil, gasoline and other refined petroleum products, but not crude oil.

description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28Two years after the Arab oil embargo against the United States, this country remains just as vulnerable to another such embargo and perhaps more so.

description: TRENTON, Oct. 28 (UPI)Governor Byrne said today that the state A F.L.C.I.O. had performed a disservice to the labor movement in its call for the defeat of six Asemblymen who voted against increasing the transportation bond issue from $560million to $600million.

description: To the best of our knowledge the League of Women Voters is the only nonpartisan organization whose object is to get people to vote and to vote intelligently. We are told it neither supports nor opposes any party or any particular candidate.

title: U.S. ENVOY CHOICE TROUBLING SWISS

description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Oct. 28 A Cambodian delegation headed by Deputy Premier Ieng Sary, the most senior Communist delegation to visit a nonCommunist Southeast Asian country since the takeover of Indochina, arrived here today.

description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28James S. Coleman, the sociologist, said today that while he no longer considered busing a valid instrument in school desegregation, he would not favor a constitutional amendment that would ban such busling.

description: MADISON, Wis., Oct. 29 (AP)The Wisconsin Supreme Court said yesterday that nondairy cream substitutes could not be banned from restaurants in Wisconsin, even if it is America's Dairyland.

description: In a quiet session, futures prices of grains and soybeans managed to move up or hold steady yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

The company is seeking a preliminary injunction to halt Imetal's $110million tender for 2.5 million shares of Copperweld common stock and for its 5 per cent subordinated convertible debentures.

It was thoughtprovoking evening, although perhaps not always in the way that Miss Oppens might have hoped.

title: PRESSMEN ARE SUED BY WASHINGTON POST
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (UPI) The Washington Post sued the striking pressmen's union today for $15million for what it termed intentional, wanton and malicious destruction of the newspaper's nine presses when the pressmen walked out Oct. 1.

title: Reforming the Charter: II
description: Some of the proposals for Charter changes in the planning process, as contained in Question Four Tuesday's ballot, are essential reforms. Others are useful but not critical; a few are dubious. In sum, however, Question Four represents a consistent, rational improvement in the basic machinery of the planning and development process for New York.

title: EDUCATORS STUDY TEST SCORE DROP
description: The College Entrance Examination Board, confounded by the continuous decline of scores on its Scholastic Aptitude Test, which is used as an admissions criterion by many colleges, announced the formation yesterday of a blueribbon panel to investigate the causes for the 12yearlong drop.

title: A Stork Believed Extinct Is Rediscovered in China
description: TIENTSIN, China, Oct. 28 (Reuters)A British ornithologist has discovered that a stork believed extinct is alive and well in a small zoo here.

title: BAYH IS CRITICAL OF HANDGUN BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (AP) Senators disagreed at a hearing today on how far the public was willing to go in tightening Federal restrictions on the sale and possession of handguns.

title: Secret Service Confirms A 2d Hartford Collision
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (AP)The Secret Service has confirmed that one of its cars bumped President Ford's limousine shortly after the Ford car was in a collision at a Hartford, Conn., intersection on Oct. 14.

title: Lynn Voted A.L. Top Rookie
description: Fred Lynn, Boston's 23yearold outfielder, was the landslide choice yesterday as the American League rookie of the year.

title: Ziggy, Bull Elephant That Spent 30 Years in Cell, Is Dead at 58
description: BROOKFIELD, Ill., Oct. 28 (AP)Ziggy, a 6ton bull elephant that spent 30 years in solitary confinement as an alleged killer before being bailed out by a children's fundraising campaign, died of old age yesterday at his Brookfield Zoo home.

description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 28A Federal district judge ordered a not guilty plea entered today for Sara Jane Moore to the charge that she had tried to assassinate President Ford.

title: LEGAL RISKS UPSET AUDITING INSTITUTE
description: The American Institute of Certified Public Accountants disclosed yesterday that it would shortly warn the public that unless lawyers provided accountants with more information about the potential financial risks of huge corporate lawsuits, auditors would refuse to give companies a clean bill of health.

title: 3 Television Stations To Carry Ford Speech
description: Channel 2, 4 and 7 will televise President Ford's speech today before the National Press Club in Washington. The speech, at noon, is to be devoted to New York City's fiscal crisis.

description: CHICAGO, Oct. 28 (AP) Doctors and interns decided today to continue their strike at the Cook County Hospital despite a court order to return to work, union officials said.

title: Borden
description: Borden, Inc., which makes a wide variety of foods, dairy products, and chemicals here and abroad, reported yesterday thirdquarter record net income of $25.5million, or 83 cents a share, up 15.4 per cent from $22.1million, or 72 cents a share, a year ago. For the nine months, net income of $70.9million, or $2.30 a share, was up 8.9 per cent from $65.1million, or $2.11 a share, last year.

title: Fly Now, Pay Later
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28President Sadat of Egypt made a good personal impression in Washington, but some things were said during his visit that foreshadow great trouble ahead in Washington's relations with both Egypt and Israel.

title: G.M. and Con Ed Net Up, While U.S. Steel Slumps
description: Thirdquarter profit reports yesterday showed that the upturn in the economy had aided some companies but not others.

title: Ashe, Nastase Score in Paris
description: PARIS, Oct. 28 (AP)Ilie Nastase threw a tantrum today, was warned by the umpire and went on to beat Egypt's Ismail El Shafei of Egypt, 98, 64, in the second round of the $50,000 Paris indoor open tennis championship.

title: Toros Triumph, 64
description: TORONTO. Oct. 28 (UPI)Vaclav Nedomansky and Gavin Kirk scored two goals each to lead the Toronto Toros to a 64 triumph over the Quebec Nordiques in World Hockey Association game tonight.

title: CONGRESS STUDIES SPY UNITS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28The House Select Committee on Intelligence is in the midst of closeddoor investigation into what its chairman has termed the risks posed by undercover intelligence operations carried out by American agencies both in this country and overseas.

title: Sandstorm Impedes Morocco Marchers
description: MARRAKESH, Morocco, Oct. 28 (AP)A desert sandstorm today swept across the Tarfaya area where 150,000 Moroccan volunteers waited in a tent camp to start a march into Spanish Sahara.

description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 28 (AP) The City of Philadelphia finished the last fiscal year with a surplus of $11.6million, according to Finance Director Lennox Moak.

T. Grant, among others.

description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 28 (AP) Pete Athas, who had won a starting job in the Cleveland Browns defensive backfield this season, was placed on waivers today by the National Football League team.

description: MILAUKEE, Oct. 28 (AP)Kareem AbdulJabbar, playing his first game against his former Milwaukee teammates, poured in 20 of his 30 points in the second half tonight and led the Los Angeles Lakers to a 9992 victory over the Bucks in an N.B.A. game.

title: Food Prices Continue to Rise
description: The cost of feeding a family of four last week in New York City went up 0.4 per cent, reversing a downward trend that went back to Sept. 26, the Department of Consumer Affairs reported yesterday.

description: An article in The New York Times on Monday incorrectly identified Scott Foresman & Co., the textbook publisher, as the owner of the New York publishing house of E. P. Dutton & Co. Foresman is the owner of William Morrow Se Co., Inc., another New York publisher, while Dutton was acquired earlier this year by Elsevier Publishing Company, N.V., of Amsterdam, a diversified Dutch publishing concern.

title: Students Will Attend Met Dress Rehearsals
description: Nearly 40,000 elementary, high school and colleg& students will see the Metropolitan Opera in action this season. A new program that will open 18 of the company's dress rehearsals to groups of 1,000 students each and another that will admit smaller groups of students to early working rehearsals of La Traviata, Aida and II Trittico will augment the longstanding special afternoon student performances made available at very low cost.

title: Georges Carpentier, Boxer, Dies in Paris
description: PARIS, Oct. 28 (AP)Georges Carpentier, who lost on a fourthround knockout to Jack Dempsey in boxine's first Slmillion gate, died last night of a heart attack. He was 81 years old.

title: ASPIN IS CHALLENGED ON GASOLINE PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (AP) Prices for regular grade gasoline have increased by a nationwide average of 8.1 per cent since the July 4th weekend, but the Government has tried to suppress figures showing the rapid climb, Representative Les Aspin, Democrat of Wisconsin, said today.

title: SUMMONS ISSUED FOR RUCKELSHAUSI
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28Former Deputy Attorney General William D. Ruckelshaus has been summoned to testify before an Indianapolis grand jury investigating the alleged burglary and illegal bugging of a close associate of Senator Vance Hartke, the prosecuting attorney's office there said today.

title: O'Hara Seeks Senate Seat
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (UPI)  Representative James G.' O'Hara, Democrat of Michigan, announced today his candidacy for the Senate seat that will become vacant witih Senator Philip A. Hart's retirement next year.

title: Tigers, Bruins Look to Rebound
description: Lack of emotion. That was Coach Bob Casciola's explanation for Princeton's 2420 loss to Penn last Saturdav. CaFciola added: Our play in the second half was very poor and very disappointing. Penn took it to us in the second half, and we didn't rise to the occasion.

title: FREDERIC E. MERWIN, TAUGHT JOURNALISM
description: Frederic E. Merwin, a former newspaperman who was director of the Rutgers School of Journalism from 1940 until his retirement in 1970, died yesterday at the Kennedy Medical Center in Edison, N. J. He was 68 years old and lived in Metuchen. N. J.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Generalissimo Francisco Franco has taken another turn for the worse and his doctors called his condition extraordinarily grave. So much improvement had been reported earlier that Government officials were said to have decided to wait until Friday in the hope that Spain's 82yearold Chief of State would be lucid enough to sign a document handing over power to his designated successor, Prince Juan Carlos de BorbOn. The urgency of filling the power vacuum was underlined by the resumption of highlevel talks with Morocco over Spanish Sahara. [Page 1, Column 1.]

title: Bodies of 2 Young Women Found in Rockland County
description: CLARKSTOWN. N.Y., Oct. 28 The bodies of two young women both apparently in their 20's, were found last night and today, seven miles apart, in wooded areas of Rockland County.

title: People and Business
description: H. Johannes Witteveen, managing director of the International Monetary Fund, said yesterday that the agency was not having an easy time in reducing the role of gold in the world's monetary system.

title: Reathel Bean Forceful as Exiled Journalist
description: The first act is an attenuated dialogue between Charleston and an old friend who is about to enter the war. The second, and the crux of the play, is a forced entry into the dream world. Here I stand in the mind of another, announces one character. The hero orders, Get out of my minda suggestion that should have been heeded.

title: Con Ed Net Rises 17.4%; Dividend Remains at 30c
description: The Consolidated Edison Company of New York, the nation's largest investorowned electric utility in terms of revenues, reported yesterday a 17.4 per cent increase in its 1975 thirdquarter net income but announced that it would continue to hold its reduced dividend payment to 30 cents a share for the quarter.

title: TV: From Variety Show to Talk Show, The Sullivan and the Carson of It All
description: There they were again, most of them anyway, on the home screen last Friday night for NBC's twohour tribute to Bob HopeJack Benny, Bing Crosby, Milton Berle, Jimmy Durante, Eddie Cantor, Frank Sinatra, Sid Caesar and Imogene Coca and, of course, the alpha and omega of American television. Ed Sullivan and Johnny Carson. It was a souffl whipped up out of 25 years of snippets, a variety program with elephantiasis.

title: Support for Loan Guarantees for City Grows in House
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28A strong majority of Democratic members of the House Banking Committee agreed at a private meeting tonight to support Federal loan guarantees for New York City if the city met certain tough conditions, according to a committee spokesman.

title: Play: Time of Your Life
description: One can grow into plays. Years ago, immediately after World War H, when I saw William Saroyan's The Time of Your Life in London, cordially disliked its whimsy, its sentiment, its lack of backbone, and its concept of life as a geewhiz circus with all of us standing round as merely clowns.

title: Advertising
description: Some supporters of advertising contend that exposure to sometimes misleading commercials helps develop consumer skills in the young. However, a recently completed research project indicates that such evidence of allowable institutional hypocrisy actually causes conflict in children that is possibly harmful and may permanently distort their views of morality, society and business.

title: A Practitioner of the New Cuisine Is Still Master of the Old
description: EUGENIELESBAINS, FranceWithin a very short span of time, this spa resort has attracted food enthusiasts from all over the world (mostly from the United States) to see what the young French chef, Michel Gurard, bath wrought with what is called la cuisine minceur, or slimming cookery.

title: Few Representatives Stay For Night Debate on City
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28More than a dozen members of the New York State House delegation vowed this evening, to keep the House of Representatives open into the late hours of the night to discuss the issues surrounding New York. City's fiscal crisis.

title: Oilers Top Roadrunners
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Oct. 28 (UPI)Ken Sheehy broke out of an extended scoring slump to lead the Edmonton Oilers to a 73 victory over the Phoenix Roadrunners in a World Hockey Association game tonight. He got two goals as he scored for the first time in 11 games this season.

title: Strike at Washingtoni Post Is Eroding Paper's Special Relationship With Employes
description: WASHINGTONOne day in 1955 Eugene Meyer, the late chairman of The Washington Post and the father of its current publisher, gave the paper's, employes a halfmillion dollars. in stock. It was, he felt, a family sort of gesture and, so he explained, Some people remember their old associates In their wills. But Mrs. Meyer and I have both thought that a rather melancholy thing to do.

title: Martha Graham Dance Troupe Plans a Record FourWeek Run
description: The Martha Graham Dance Company will hold the longest season given by a single moderndance company here when it opens a fourweek run at the Mark Hellinger Theater on Dec. 8. The engagement will include a salute to Aaron Copland and a new work dedicated to Katharine Cornell, The Scarlet Letter.

Foresman is the owner of William Morrow & Co., inc., another New York publisher, while Dutton was acquired earlier this year by Elsevier Publishing Company, N.V., of Amsterdam, a diversified Dutch publishing concern.

title: Braves Trounce Rockets
description: BUFFALO, Oct. 28 (AP)Bob McAdoo scored 34 points and Ernie DiGregorio and Randy Smith combined for 42 as they powered the Buffalo Braves to a 124108 victory tonight over the Houston Rockets in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Chicago, Rock Island Gets Loan Guarantees
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (UPI)  The Department of Transportation decided today to make available as much as $19million in loan guarantees to the ailing Chicago Rock Island & Pacific Railroad.

title: Proposal to Admit Boys Is Voted Down By the Girl Scouts
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (AP) The Girl Scouts voted overwhelmingly here today not to admit boys to their organization.

title: Proxmire and Stevenson Agree on City Aid Action
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28Senator William Proxmire, chairman of the Senate Banking Committee, and Senator Adlai E. Stevenson 3d of Illinois agreed today to a compromiz that both supporters and opponents said assured the committee's narrow approval of $4billion loanguarantee bill for New York City.

title: RumrillHoyt Shows Belief in Big Apple
description: Up to now it's been mostly the bankers and the politicians who have been trying to help New York, observes Eugene Novak, president of RumrillHoyt, who went on to suggest that it was time for the city's massive creative resources to make a move.

title: Proud Catalan Minority Insists On Changes for Spain
description: BARCELONA, Spain, Oct. 28 The Catalans, a proud linguistic minority of nearly eight million people within the Spanish state, appear more united than ever before in their fractious and warravaged history in calling for speedy political change in this country.

title: $1Billion Is Slated for the Oil Concerns
description: The three largest producing companiesthe Exxon Corporation's Creole Petroleum Corporation subsidiary, the Royal Dutch/Shell Group and the Gulf Oil Corporation  which jointly handle about two million barrels of Venezuela's 2.1 million barrels a day output, waited until the last minute accept the offers.

title: Hankyu Braves Win
description: HIROSHIMA, Japan, Oct. 23 (AP)The Hankyu Braves, winners of the Pacific League pennant, scored three runs on two homers in the top of the ninth inning today and beat the Central League champion, Hiroshima Toyo Carp. 74, in the third game of the fourofsevengame Japan series. It was the Braves second victory in the series.

title: House Data Subpoenaed In U.S. Inquiry on Maraziti
description: NEWARK, Oct. 28 (AP)Federal authorities today began to examine a drawer full of documents subpoenaed from the House of Representatives in connection with an investigation of charges that former Representative Joseph J. Maraziti employed a friend in a no show Capitol Hill job.

title: Ford Yields to Judge, Plans Videotape Deposition in Fromme Trial
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Oct. 28Yielding to a ruling by a Federal judge, President Ford will give an unprecedented videotape deposition as a defense witness in the trial of Linette Alice Fromme, who is charged with attempting to assassinate the President while he was visiting here Sept. 5.

title: 2 FROM YONKERS BACK U.S. AID HERE
description: Faced with a possible fiscal default by the City of Yonkers, that city's two Representatives in Congress yesterday appealed for swift Federal credit guarantees for New York City as a means of saving financially troubled localities across the: country.

title: Shock Wave of Nevada ABlast Felt Hundreds of Miles Away
description: PAHUTE MESA, Calif., Oct. 28 (UPI)An underground nuclear explosion with the estimated force of nearly a million tons of TNT was set off in Nevada today, swaying chandeliers and power lines in Las Vegas, 100 miles from the test site. The shock wave was felt 300 miles away in Los Angeles and Sacramento, Calif.

title: Spanish Reds Say They Seek Pluralistic Society
description: MADRID, Oct. 28The Spanish Communist party is drawing up plans to force its full; and equal participation in Spain's legal political life as liberalization is extended to other groups, according to party spokesmen in Madrid.

title: Oklahoma Inmates Free 2 They Held Hostage in Kitchen
description: GRANITE, Okla., Oct. 28 (UPI)  Seven inmates of the Oklahoma State Reformatory today accepted a promise of reduction of their sentences for kidnaping and they released unharmed two hostages they had held for more than a day in the prison kitchen.

title: School Board Members To Cut Personal Staffs
description: The members of the Board of Education are planning to cut the size of their personal staffs, from a present totall of 27 assistants and clerical, employes to 23, as part of the school system's latest economies.

title: Sponsor Dropping Out
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Oct. 28 (UPI)  The Brown & Williamson Tobacco Corporation announced today it was withdrawing sponsorship of the VelsParnelli Jones and Black American Racers auto racing teams at the end of this year.

title: Bears
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 28 (UPI)Carl Marasco, director of player personnel for the Chicago Bears, was in the intensive care unit of PresbyterianSt. Lukes Hospital today with an undiagnosed ailment. The 39yearold Marasco was described in fair condition. He entered the hospital two weeks ago with what was believed to be pancreatic inflammation.

title: Gulf, Cities Service and Atlantic Off
description: The Gulf Oil Corporation, the Atlantic Richfield Company and the Cities Service Company all announced yesterday sharply lower earnings for the third quarter and first nine months of 1975, following the trend established by most of their competitors.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: Many people know that the Federal Environmental Protection Agency's gasoline mileage tests do not yield results that can be translated into mileage in actual driving situations. The tests are run, not on the road, but on dynamometer, and the test car's drive wheels turn on steel rollers. There are thus no cornering forces to counteract and no wind or true road resistance to overcome.

title: A TIMES SQ. TEAM PRESSES CLEANUP

title: SURPLUS IN TRADE AT 5MONTH LOW
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (UPI) The United States exported more than it imported in September, but an increase in oil and sugar imports forced the balanceoftrade surplus to the lowest level since last April, the Government said today.

title: Red Cross to Teach Means of Rescuing Persons Who Choke
description: The American Red Cross said yesterday that it would begin to teach the Heimlich maneuver, a means of rescuing persons who are unable to breathe because they are choking on food or other objects.

title: Waldheim Will Visit Cuba For a Caribbean Meeting
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 28  Secretary General Waldheim is scheduled to pay a threeday visit to Cuba, beginning Sunday, a United Nations spokesman announced today.

title: A $200Million Land Swindle Is Charged
description: A realestate group was indicted yesterday on accusations of a $200million swindle in the public sale of undeveloped semiarid desert lots in a New Mexico area called Rio Rancho Estates.

title: RUMANIA PRESIDENT BEGINS LISBON VISIT
description: LISBON, Oct. 28 (AP)President Nicolae Ceausescu of Rumania arrived here today for four days of talks. He is the first Communist chief of state to visit Portugal.

title: Books of The Times
description: When I look at some of my friends who have outgrown. or been psychoanalyzed away from, the peculiarities that originally drew me to them, I wish there were something like an Institute for Regression where they could go and have their psyches turned back like a clock or speedometer.

title: BYRNE DUE TO PICK FRIEND OF CAREYS
description: TRENTON, Oct. 28As a favor to Governor Carey of New York and at the apparent insistence of high officials in the Carey administration, Governor Byrne is prepared to nominate a New Jersey friend of the Carey family to the Palisades Interstate Park Commission.

title: Billikens Are Still Convinced They Are the Team to Beat in Soccer
description: After St. Louis University lost to San Francisco and Clemson early in the season, Harry Keough's message to rival coaches was loud and clear: Don't count us out yet. We are still the team to beat. No soccer coach in the right frame of mind would count out the Billikens, who have won more national titles than anybody else. And Keough, their coach, doesn't like to hide things from his friends, who are mostly coaches.

title: OIL TALKS SEEN FAVORABLE TO U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28The chief United States representative in trade talks with the Soviet Union told Congress today he expected negotiations: on an oil deal to produce prices, that would clearly be favorable to this country.

title: Baer and Burstein Running on Records
description: ENGLEWOOD, Oct. 28Assemblymen Byron M. Baer of Englewood and Albert Burstein of Tenafly, both Democrats, seem confident these days that their achievements during two terms in the State Legislature will win them reelection next Tuesday in Bergen County's 37th Assembly District.

title: Senate Condemns Action On Zionism by U.N. Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (AP) The Senate approved a resolution today that condemns finding by a United Nations committee that Zionism is form of racism and race discrimination.

title: The New York Time/Paul Hosefros SALUTING HER 89TH: An old soldier saluted at the base of the Statue of Liberty as women members of the National Veterans of Foreign Wars Auxiliary presented the colors. Occasion was ceremony marking the 89th birthday of the statue on Liberty Island.

title: Warriors Display Title Form In 11194 Victory Over Knicks
description: The Golden State Warriors showed all the ingredients last night that won them the National Basketball Association championship last season. In drubbing the Knicks. 11194, before a crowd of 17,186 at Madison Square Garden, the Warriors thoroughly outhustled and outrebounded the New Yorkers.

title: F.D.A. Refuses to Prohibit Drug Prescribed for Women
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (UPI) The Food and Drug Administration has refused to ban a drug prescribed for women more than two million times a year, saying its cancercausing potential in test animals apparently does not pose a similar risk to humans.

title: Balance Helps Celtics Sink Warriors, 115106
description: BOSTON, Oct. 29 (AP)The Boston Celtics survived Rick Barry's 17point second period and rallied in the second half with a balanced attack tonight for a 115106 National Basketball Association victory over the Golden State Warriors.

title: Herzog &
description: Herzog & Co., a stock brokerage house, has confirmed reports that it plans to move from New York City to Jersey City to escape the recently increased stock transfer tax in New York State.

title: Pension Funds Near Pact On Backing Loans to City
description: A plan to borrow $4billion against municipal union pension funds to avoid default by the city in December and meet its cash needs in the rest of the fiscal year and possibly for two more years is expected to be put into final form soon, perhaps as early as this weekend.

title: Douglas Is Taken To Medical Center With Slight Fever
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 29Supreme Court Justice William 0. Douglas, whose poor health had already cast uncertainty over the new Court year, was taken to Walter Reed Army Medical Center early this morning because of what Court and hospital officials later described as a slight fever.

title: BAILOUT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 29, President Ford said today that he was prepared to veto any bill that would rescue New York City by having the Federal Government guarantee the availability of funds to prevent a default.

title: Soviet Lofts Cosmos 777
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 29 (UPI)The 777th earth satellite in the Soviet Union's Cosmos series was placed in orbit today to conduct space research, lass, the Soviet press agency, said. All equipment aboard the craft was functioning normally, Tass said.

title: Notes on People
description: Judged by his own experience serving in countries lost to the Communists no longer ruins a United States diplomat's career, John Gunther Dean said yesterday at his swearingin as Ambassador to Denmark. Mr. Dean, 49 years old, the Ambassador to Cambodia until it fell and to Laos earlier, noted that American cafeeis were broken when Communists took over China, but he said that the mistakes of the early fifties will not be repeated.

title: Doctors Striking Hospital in Chicago Call Quality of Patient Care a Key Issue
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 29Internes and residents of the city's only public hospital continued their strike today in defiance of a judge's order to return to work.

title: Chess
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 29Alexander Belyavsky, the 20yearold cochampion of the Soviet Union, capitalized on errors by Viktor Korchnoi in a rookandpawn ending and by me in a queenandpawn ending to win two adjourned games in the Alekhine Memorial Tournament here in the Central Chess Club.

title: SENATORS STUDY REGULATORY UNITS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 29Two Senate committees began today an unusual $500,000 study to find out what is wrong with Federal regulatory agencies and what can: be done to improve their performance.

title: Two Chiropractors Are Named in Arson And Medicaid Fraud
description: Two chiropractors who operated several medical centers in the Bronx and Brooklyn were indicted yesterday on 242 counts involving arson, grand larceny and defrauding Medicaid, as well as health and fire insurance companies.

title: A Cloudy 10th Anniversary for Rhodesians
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia On Nov. 11 white Rhodesians will mark the 10th anniversary of their declaration of independence from Britain. They demonstrate pride in having prospered

title: About the Evidence
description: McLEAN, Va.I served on the staff of the Warren Commission. And although it is voguish to say otherwise. I think we wrote a good report. I continue to be amazed at how many new discoveries that appear in critical literature were discussed in the report, and at how many people are prepared to dismiss the report without having bothered to read it.

title: Writers and Sports: In This League, Pete Rose Outhits Gustave Flaubert
description: Two quotes. The first is from Wilfrid Sheed's Muhammad Ali, describing the writers who follow the champion: . . . the press room looked like Madame de Stael's salon in Paris. The second is from Norman Mailer's The Fight, reporting from Zaire: A victory for Ali would also be a victory for Islam. . . It was striking how many of the Jewish writers at Nsele had affection for Ali, a veritable tropism of affection, as if, ultimately, he was one of them, a Jew in the sense of being his own creation. Few things would inspire more love among Jews than the genius to be without comparison.

title: Pension Funds Near Pact On Backing Loans to City
description: A plan to borrow $4billion against municipal union pension funds to avoid default by the city in December and meet its cash needs in the rest of the fiscal year and possibly for two more years is expected to be put into final form soon, perhaps as early as this weekend.

title: Embassy Fire in Vienna
description: VIENNA, Oct. 29 (Reuters)A fire at the Chinese embassy here today caused damage worth about $50,000 and threatened the British ambassador's residence, firemen said.

title: Plunkett Gets Surgery
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Oct. 29 (AP)  Jim Plunkett, quarterback for the New England Patriots, underwent surgery here today for removal of a surgical screw from his left shoulder. Everything went just fine, said Dr. Frederick Behling. Jim should be ready to resume activity in about two weeks.

title: Jumper Title Taken By J. C. Superstar
description: LANDOVER, Md., Oct. 29 Cheryl Johnston's J. C. Superstar gave a sparkling speed performance at the Washington International horse show tonight and won the internationalopen jumper class.

title: National NoFault Insurance Approved by House Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 29 (AP) A nofault automobile inurance bill that would require states to meet certain national standards within three years was approved today by a House Commerce subcommittee.

title: Conversations
description: There are some artists whose lifestyle is almost more interesting than their work  they talk the longshort night away, and their brilliance is all lost on guttering candles and dimly held memories. Brendan Behan, the Irish playwright and personality, was almost like that. But he was not a Coleridge his table talk was not of surpassing brilliance. He was not a Wildehis life never had that special kingfisher flash. And his lifestyle was a deathstyle.

title: Zenith Radio
description: The Zenith Radio Corporation reported yesterday that its net income in the third quarter was $8.6million, or 46 cents a share. A year ago a 10week strike at a large color television plant resulted In a net lots of $5.6million.

title: The Unanswered Questions in Ford Bankruptcy Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 29If President Ford or Congress finally deal with the New York fiscal crisisan event that appears increasingly likelythe Federal Government will be put into the position of making basic deciNews sions that are traAnalysis ditionally in the purview of state and local officials.

title: Bangalore Court Comes to Grips With Key Case in India's Crisis
description: BANGALORE, India, Oct. 28 In a rosecolored 100yearold courthouse here, lawyers for and against the federal Government are painstakingly arguing the legal theories behind the rigorous state of emergency that has held India in its grip since June.

title: Rangers Set Back Blues, 31, Ending 3Game Losing Streak
description: The St. Louis Blues answered the Rangers S O S last night at Madison Square Garden. The club many persons have termed the farm team of the Rangers because they have exchanged 21 players over the last eight years, dropped a 31 verdict to the Rangers, ending New York's threegame losing streak.

title: WEST SIDERS CITE ANGER ON TRASH
description: Littered streets, uncollected garbage and less than friendly sanilationmen were discussed, sometimes heatedly, last night at a meeting of Sanitation Department officials and representatives of West Side block associations.

title: Article 4  No Title
Will Rogers Hospital Says It Will Close on Dec. 31
description: SARANAC LAKE, N.Y., Oct. 29 (AP)The Will Rogers Memoral Hospital will close Dec. 31, according to information given to employes at the hospital today.

title: Senators Hear SleepAid Drugs Are Ineffective, Possibly a Peril
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 29The overthecounter drugs that millions of Americans use as sleep aids and sedatives are probably ineffective in the recommended dosages and could be hazardous in larger quantities doctors told a Senate subcommittee hearing today.

title: Franco Loyalists Resist Political Change
description: MADRID, Oct. 29The ceremony today marking the 42d anniversary of the founding of Generalissimo Francisco Franco's Falange party was brief and businesslike.

title: A First Lady for Egypt's Handicapped
description: Jihan elSadat, the First Lady of Egypt, spent part of her first day in New York yesterday at a rehabilitation center watching a man being fitted for an artificial arm, a quadriplegic use a typewriter and a group of patients with broken necks play a modified game of basketball.

title: What President Calls Bailout
description: President Ford and Governor Carey have a running disagreement over semantics and in particulary over the use of a single, emotionladen wordbailout.

title: Tennessee Prison Jammed
description: NASHVILLE, Oct. 29 (UPI)The inmate population at the Tennessee state penitentiary hit a record level today and corrections officials asked county sheriffs to send no more prisoners.

title: Ford, in Slip of Tongue, Hails Sadat as Israeli
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 29 (AP)  President Anwar elSadat and President Ford got a laugh out of a slip by Mr. Ford during a dinner toast last night honoring the Egyptian chief of state. Mr. Ford's spokesman said today.

title: Policies Scored at Rockefeller Forum
description: TAMPA. Fla., Oct. 29 Red tape, inefficiency and insensiti vity were ascribed to the Federal Government here today as a wide range of Southerners addressed Vice President Rock lefeller and other Federal officials in a forum on the Ford Administration's domestic policies.

title: SALES RISE BY 8.5% FOR CHAIN STORES
description: Chain store sales in September rose by 8.5 per cent over the level of September, 1974, Chain Store Age magazine has reported.

title: ExAides to Presidents Assess Scientists
description: PHILDELPHIA, Oct. 29As Congress moves closer to reestablishing the fulltime office of Presidential science adviser, the six men who held the job under four Presidents met here yesterday and today to assess where and how scientists could make a contribution to public

title: Ford Cites New York's Ills In Urging Balanced Budget
description: LOS ANGELES. Oct. 29 President Ford declared here tonight that the Federel budget must be balanced if the nation is to avoid what is happening in New York City.

title: Most of the Nation's Alices
description: Alice Doesn't. a nationwide strike called by the National Organization for Women, fizzled in much of the country yesterday because most Alices did.

title: Only the Beginning
description: BOSTON, Oct. 29New York City will before long default on its financial obligations. That much is certain, or virtually so, after President Ford's forceful No to the calls for Federal action to stave off default. The efforts to get rescue legislation through Congress might as well be abandoned. There is going to be no miracle in Washington.

title: 2 Rival Measures On Korea Approved By U.N. Committee
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 29  The General Assembly's Political Committee tonigla approved two conflicting resolutions on Korea, creating a situation that many members openly deplored as confused and that some privately described as pure nonsense.

title: Market Place
description: Some market analysts have wondered why the United States Steel Corporation has turned in such a strong performance in the stock market while smaller companies more likely to do well in a brisk economic recovery have not fared so well.

title: Choice of Carey Friend Fought in Jersey
description: TRENTON, Oct. 29A bipartisan coalition of State Senators from Bergen County said today they had agreed to block Governors Byrne's prospective nomination of a New Jersey friend of Governor Carey to the Palisades Interstate Park Commission.

title: INCURSION IN GOLAN IS FOILED BY ISRAEL
description: TEL AVIV, Oct. 29The Israeli military command said today that soldiers on the Golan Heights had foiled a terrorist raid from Syrian territory. It was the first such raid since the two countries signed an accord on separation of forces in May. 1974.

title: BlackLung Aid to Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 29 (UPI) Blacklung benefit payments to coal miners and their fain ilies will increase by 5 per cent beginning with checks going out in early November, the Social Security Commissioner, James B. Cardwell, announced today.

title: CLEVELAND FACING CLOSE MAYOR VOTE
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 29Next Tuesday, Cleveland could become the first big city to elect its second black Mayor.

title: TRENTON STUDIES HEALTH AID PLAN
description: TRENTON, Oct. 29Assembly leaders here said today they were prepared to cooperate with Governor Byrne in seeking a $20million emergency appropriation by the Legislature to avoid further cutbacks in basic health services for the poor.

title: 2 Missing Bergen Women Murdered by Strangulation
description: Continued From Page I, Col. 3 by workmen inTallman Mountain State Park, just north of Bergen County, was identified earlier today as that of Susan Reeve, 22. She never arrived home after leaving a commuter bus near her parents house in Demarest, on Oct. 14.

title: Places and Fantasies
description: Places and Fantasies esscntially identifies the content of the six short subjects that opened a twoweek engagement yesterday at the Whitney Museum of American Art. But if the collection expectedly illustrates the avantgarde's independent approach to moviemaking, the films, made between 1961 and this year, not only reflect individualism but also range widely in effect.

title: Energy Conservation Is Becoming a Habit
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 29Despite their reputation for profligacy, most Americans seem to he trying to save energy. At least, they say they are.

title: CHILE'S AUSTERITY CURBS INFLATION
description: SANTIAGO, ChileThe rigorous austerity plan adopted by the military junta to halt Chile's runaway inflation is making painful progress, but the economy is still handtomouth.

title: Transcript of President's Talk on City Crisis, Questions Asked and His Responses
description: Following is the transcript of an address by President Ford at the National Press Club, and questions and answers following the speech, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: ExSpurs Help Nets Triumph
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Oct. 29 Swen Nater and Rich Jones showed a Nassau Coliseum crowd and the San Antonio Spurs tonight why the New York Nets had acquired them in the offseason.

title: CARTER FREEDOM OPPOSED BY P.B.A.
description: The New Jersey Policemen's Benevolent Association yesterday urged Governor Byrne to deny executive clemency to Rubin (Hurricane) Carter.

title: Deaths
Sao Paulo Student Strike Protests Newsman's Death
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Oct. 29 (UPI)Students of the University of Sao Paulo began a threeday strike today in protest against the death of Waldimir Herzog, news director of a Sao Paulo television station.

title: Concert: Soviet Virtuoso
description: The Soviet Union exports violinists almost the way the United States does wheat. They are firstrate, too, but Vladimir Spivakov, who played in Carnegie Hall on Tuesday night, may well be the best of the recent lot. He is quite an extraordinary artist.

title: Cleveland Curbs Clue Sales
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 29 (UPI) It is no longer legal to sell glue, plastic cement or even nail polish remover to anyone under 21 years old in Cleveland. The City Council unanimously passed a law Monday night to ban the sales because such substances can be sniffed to get high. Violators risk a fine of up to $200 and a maximum jail setence of 90 days.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: State Attorney General William F. Hyland announced yesterday that his first assistant, Robert .1. Del Tufo, would be the state's new Criminal Justice Director, succeeding Matthew P. Boylan, who is leaving the post Dec. 31 return to his law practice. Mr. Del Tufo, 41, who was born in Newark, lives in Morristown. He is a former assistant Morris County prosecutor and legal secretary to Joseph Weintraub, former Chief Justice of the State Supreme Court. Mr. Del Tufo has been Mr. Hyland's first assistant two years.

title: SCHLESINGER GETS ARMS FUND REBUFF
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 29The Senate Defense Appropriations subcommittee, in a serious setback for Defense Secretary James R. Schlesinger, voted today to restore only $406million to a defense appropriations bill that was reduced $7.6billion by the House.

title: Horse Show Lists Dressage Specialty
description: John Wumett of Tuexdo Park, N.Y., and Elizabeth Lewis of Marietta, Ga., will perform a dressage pas de deux at the National Horse Show, Ted Cushney, president of the show, which opens next Tuesday at Madison Square Garden, said yesterday. The two will perform on the evening of Nov. 7 in both the afternoon and evening sessions of Nov. 8.

title: Grain Inspection Unit to Lose License
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 29The Agriculture Department announced today that it would cancel the graininspection authority of one of the private inspection agencies now under investigation in the New Orleans area.

title: 2 Jersey Women Died of Strangling
description: POMONA, N.Y., Oct. 29Two bodies found seven miles apart in wooded areas of Rockland County this week have been identified as those of two young women who disappeared earlier this month from an affluent area of northeastern Bergen County, N.J.

title: Du Pont Increasing Dacron Fiber Price By 5 Cents a Pound
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc., announced yesterday an increase in the price of its Dacron polyester staple fiber af 5 cents a pound, or about 10 per cent. The increase is efPrice Changes fective Dec. I. In other pricing actions, the Amencan Cyanamid Company announced it would raise prices by 7 to 9 per ccnt for its beetle urea molding cornpounds, effective Nov. 15. The compounds are used principally for wiring devices, closures and buttons. The company said these increases, which are the first since September, 1974, had been made necessary by the higher costs of raw materials, labor and energy.

title: People and Business
description: David P. Reynolds, chairman of the Aluminum Association, said yesterday at its annual meeting that aluminum industry shipments next year should increase by 30 per cent above their low level of 1975.

title: Television
description: Gene Hackman in The French Connection (1972), on Channel 2 at 9 P.M.

title: Yonkers Entries
4 Sisters Long in Foster Care Ordered Returned to Mother
description: A State Supreme Court Justice in Nassau County awarded the custody of four young sisters to their natural mother yesterday after a yearlong court fight between the mother land the girls foster parents.

title: Leading Economic Index Declined for September
description: WASHINGTON. Oct. 29The Government's composite index of leading indicators of the economy dipped in September after six months of increases, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Security Chief Who Shuns Publicity Lew Allen Jr.
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 29As a teenager. Lew Allen Jr. wanted In he a newspaperman like his father but now, as a lieutenant general heading the highly secretive

title: Giants Stand Pat to Build Confidence
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., Oct. 29Despite the New York Giants defeat by the St. Louis Cardinals last week, Coach Bill Arnsparger is not planning any wholesale changes in his starting lineup for Saturdays game against the San Diego Chargers at Shea Stadium.

title: Head of Athletics Is Named
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 29 (UPI)E. Kaye Hart, an assistant professor of physical education, at the University of Tennessee, has been named director of women's athletics at Temple University.

title: New York Times Names Officers
description: The New York Times Company announced yesterday the appointment of a senior vice president, three vice presidents and a vice president of The Times newspaper.

title: Sunday Racing Stopped
description: Starting this weekend, New York horseplayers will have to look beyond Belmont Park or Aqueduct for Sunday thoroughbred action.

title: Excerpts From Text of President Sadat's Speech to the U.N. General Assembly
description: UNITED NATIONS. N.Y., Oct. 29Following are excerpts from the address today by President Anwar elSadat of Egypt to the United Nations General Assembly, as translated from the Arabic by the Egyptian delegation here:

title: 1776 Instant Lottery
description: TRENTON, Oct. 29The director of the state lottery today announced the formation of a new instant lottery game based on a Bicentennial theme and featuring a grand prize of $1,776 a week for life.

title: Red Wings 6, Seals 4
description: DETROIT, Oct. 29 (AP)Walt McKechnie and Mickey Redmond scored two goals apiece and led the Red Wings to a 64 victory tonight over the California Seals.

title: SHOP TALK
description: There is a great difference between looking at an object and getting inside itespecially if it's a mask. Not a Halloween type, but an abstract, almost ritual, almost magical, kind of mask. A sculptor's mask.

title: Oliver Nelson, 43, Composer And Jazz Saxophonist, Dead
description: Oliver Nelson. a widely known composer, conductor and arranger, died Monday evening, apparently of a heart attack, in Los Angeles. He was 43 years old and lived in that city.

title: Student Is Electrocuted
description: STANFORD, Calif. Oct. 29 (UPI)A 27yearold graduate student in physics was electrocuted in a campus laboratory yesterday while working on a laser experiment. Stanford university officials said that Charles D. Hawley, of New Haven, Conn., apparently touched a high voltage wire.

title: Beirut Again Seeks Truce; Many Americans Leaving
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Thursday. Oct. 30Premier Rashid Karami yesterday continued his attempt to bring about a ceasefire in the factional fighting that has turned much of Beirut into a battlefield.

title: 1776 Instant Lottery
description: TRENTON, Oct. 29The director of the state lottery today announced the formation of a new instant lottery game based on a Bicentennial theme and featuring a grand prize of $1,776 a week for life.

title: Plays
Gunman Seizes 7 in Cleveland After Attempting to Rob Bank
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 29 (AP)A man who said he was carrying explosives seized seven hostages and held off the police at a West Side bank today after his robbery attempt failed.

title: Gulf &
description: Gulf 84 Western Industries Inc., a widely diversified industrial company, reported yesterday the highest sales and earnings in its 20year history for both the final quarter and fiscal year ended July 31. The profit gains of 42 per cent for the quarter and 39 per cent for the year were also tho largesl on record, according to a company spokesman.

title: Man Held in Robbery of Elderly Women
description: A 21yearold man was arraigned in Bronx Municipal Court yesterday in the beating and robbing of two elderly persons in a Tremont housing project, and the police said they believe he was responsible for at least 40 similar robberies there over the last year.

title: Newburgh City Judge Placed on Suspension
description: NEWBURGH, N.Y., Oct. 29 (AP)Judge Albert MacDowell of City Court was suspended by the Appellate Division today and replaced by Judge Daniel Becker of the Court of Claims.

title: BLASTS, COUP RUMOR WORRY PORTUGUESE
description: LISBON, Oct. 29 (Reuters)Bombs apparently planted by extreme rightwingers blasted two cars in the northern city of Oporto today and radical leftists charged that the air force was planning a counterrewolutionary coup.

title: Record PublicTV Rating for Incredible Machine
description: The Incredible Machine. National Geographic special on the human body televised on PBS Tuesday night, swamped all commercial programs here in drawing the highest Nielsen rating ever for a publictelevision program on WNET/13.

title: MEMORIAL SERVICE FOR ORISON MARDEN
description: More than 500 judges, lawyers, friends and relaiives paid tribute yesterday to Orison S. Marden, a Wall Street lawyer who headed dozens of legal organizations.

title: U.S. Calls for Restraint
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 29The State Department said today that in recent days it had asked other interested Governments, primarily Israel and Syrianot to intervene in the crisis in Lebanon.

title: News Summary and Index
description: President Anwar elSadat formally asked the United Nations to help reconvene the Geneva conference to make use of a unique opportunity for peace in present circumstances in the Middle East. Addressing the General Assembly, he appealed to Secretary General Waldheim, the United States and the Soviet Union to start consultations for an early resumption of the peace talks. Such consultations, the Egyptian President said, should be considered with all the interested parties including the Palestine Liberation Organization. [Page 1, Columns 12.]

title: Business Briefs
description: The Department of Labor and the Internal Revenue Service have granted securities firms a permanent exemption from sweeping provisions of the Employment Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to make it easier for brokers and dealers to maintain operations with pension funds.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Blast in London Restaurant Near the American Embassy Injures 18
description: LONDON, Thursday, Oct. 30 (AP)A bomb exploded last night inside an Italian restaurant in a fashionable London district. Scotland Yard said at least 18 persons were injured.

title: Sadat Urges U.N. to Help In Resuming Geneva Talk
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 29President Anwar elSadat of Egypt said today that present circumstances provided a unique opportunity for peace in the Middle East, and formally requested the United Nations to help reconvene the Geneva conference.

title: Shipping/Mails
Dave Anderson
description: In protesting the degrading violente that keeps spreadIng deeper into the hockey psyche, Bobby Hull went on strike. He didn't play for the Winnipeg Jets in their World Hockey Association game against the Denver Spurs last Friday night. Missing one game was enough. I accomplished, he says, what I wanted to. He had embarrassed hockey with his sitdown strike. Hockey Sports doesn't blush easily but it did this time. of If somebody such as Bobby Hull, a left wing of muscle and consciertce, is Angry The Times enough not to play in protest, perhaps something really is wrongnot only in the W.1LA. but also in the National Hockey League where the Philadelphia Flyers have popularized muggirrg. Violence permeates all hockey today, from small boys to men preAtimably old enough to know better. What incensed Bobby Hull involved small boys as well as men presumably old enough to know better.

title: People in Sports
description: It was Carlton Fisk Day in New Hampshire, and when the crowd of 800 in the State House plaza at Concord cried Carlton Fisk for Governor, the Boston Red Sox catcher responded with, And if I'm elected . . . . Fisk, whose homer won Game 6 of the World Series, grew up in Charleston, played ball at the state university and lives in Raymond.

title: Ford's Stance Criticized By 8 of 10 Financial Men
description: Eight leading bankers and securities executives, representing a wide cross section of the financial community, criticized parts of President Ford's newly stated position on Federal aid for New York City yesterday. Two financial executives said they supported the President.

Addressing the General Assembly, he appealed to Secretary General Waldheim, the United States and the Soviet Union to start consultations for an early resumption of the peace talks. Such consultations, the Egyptian President said, should be considered with all the interested parties including the Palestine Liberation Organization.
